text: The inside of Rooster's is fine, and the service is nice, but it's sneakily expensive and a little frustrating because of the combination of high prices and a la carte menu.. The meat portions are very, very small. Vegetable and other choices are relatively larger. I ordered the hangar steak and it was literally 6-7 bites for $18. I'd consider this more of an over-priced tapas restaurant than anything else.  Although all of the food was quite good, I won't be back as there are too many other choices providing a better experience.

Had lunch a few days ago at the South Park location. Loved the interior, wine for days with a comfortable feel. My salad was perfect, not too big, scallops were tasty. Our server seemed busy but was very friendly and stopped by often to check in. Desserts were also tasty.

Consistently good and our favorite go-to place in Charlotte. Always delicious and I love how the staff seem to know us now and make an effort to chat. Truly feels like a neighborhood restaurant. LOVE Jim Noble's purpose and mission too.

Love this place...Live a few minutes down the street and is the first choice when friends come in town. Great food, good ambiance (some noise and good crowds but not too loud), and a cool setup/decor make for an awesome dinner.

Strongly recommend the wings and any of the potatoes au gratin

The wait staff were wonderful, the restaurant very nice. My husband had the salami and cheese pizza which was excellent. I had the heirloom tomato salad. The tomatoes could have been more flavorful. Overall will return and try other menu items.

Service was great. Ambiance was great. Bbq chicken was tremendous. Don't recommend the salmon (very basic, came undercooked). Coconut cake is a must have. I just can't give 5 stars because I was let down with the entrees overall. Simplistic dishes.

Disappointing - met a friend there for dinner; he had been there several times but this was our first visit. My friend and I had the quarter chicken natural, which was fine, but on the small side. It was tasty enough, but not particularly juicy ( the kind of moist chicken that I would expect for $11). My wife ordered the " famous" six small shrimp for $17. Seriously?

We also ordered three sides - the corn, the beats and the succotash - all were fine but not unique in any way.

Since we split the bill with our friend, my part was $45 and some change for the chicken, 6 shrimp and two rather small sides. We left feeling a bit hungry.

There are many, many more excellent restaurants in the area where $45 + tip would have gotten us a more interesting and unique meal for that amount. Cafe Monte on Fairview, Upstream, and Village Tavern immediately come to mind.

Bottom line: food didn't have any pizazz, the prices were way out of line and we'll not likely give Roosters our patronage in the future. Just too many other good places in the South Park area
Great food, great wine list. Specialty wines by the glass.
Service is always exceptional! Especially if you just grab some drinks from the bar. The hostess is always really nice and friendly.

Went here for business dinner two years ago and was good. Went here tonight for dinner and the dining experience was underwhelming to say the least. Service was horrible at best. First all of our meals come out except for one...it finally was delivered 5 minutes late. My husband ordered the large pork chop which was served cold and raw in the middle. The restaurant staff insisted it was cooked medium as ordered. Finally they took it back, and brought back the same pork chop which was still not cooked. Again, they insisted it was cooked correctly. No one wants to eat raw pork for obvious reasons. The prommes frites came out cold as if they had been sitting out all night. Those had to go back...the fresh ones were good. My husband ordered a Cabernet and was brought some red blend wine. We were afraid to say anything at this point. Ruined my birthday dinner with friends to say the least. Frosting on the cake...only one women's  bathroom stall was opened for entire restaurant so had to go to Walgreens down the street to use restroom because there were so many people in line to use the one at restaurant. Also food was delivered and it took us a while to flag some one down to bring us forks so we could eat. Oh ...well after some complaining and returning pork chop for the third time we got pork chop comped. Don't waste your money on this poorly managed restaurant. Go to Dresslers, Vivace, Carpe Diem or one of the other of comparable restaurants in Charlotte. By the way, the manager never came over to our table. Too busy.
This place is always good. I eat here as often as possible. The food is great and so is the service!

I was at rooster's two days ago for dinner. I love the atmosphere there. 
The open kitchen is great and the weird wall of roosters is okay in my book.
I ordered the gnocchi with duck confit. When it arrived I was shocked by the size of it. It looked like an appetizer. I couldn't believe they didn't at least try to beef it up with more spinach and onions! When I bit into it I was in heaven. It was incredible. Perfect tender pieces of gnocchi and wonderfully flavorful duck in a sauce that I was scooping up with bread when I was done. My only complaint-not enough(although that's a big complaint). If they presented their dishes as small plates that would be one thing, but I placed my order expecting a nice sized plate of food(not a huge amount but a bit more than I got). That being said, I would return to rooster's,I just might eat a light snack before I leave home.

Food was amazing and service was great. I had wood fire wings, Mac and cheese, salmon and pineapple crush cocktail. All of it was just great!! Atmosphere was wonderful as well. Just Fabulous. Highly Recommend !!

Too many misses for us to go back, starting with the slow service and ending with over priced offerings for our tastes. I like to say something nice so I will add that our onion soup was quite good and the very small mushroom pizza....well, .nothing special but since I love mushrooms, I liked it ok. We asked for bread while we waited and what there was of it, was good. We certainly did not leave feeling stuffed so I guess that's a good thing! Just a little let down.

Great place if poor service and expensive cold food is your thing. The service was unbearably slow.  They ran out of pork shoulder and au gratin potatoes. When we were finally served it was cold. The bill was incorrect twice!  AVOID!!

What a wonderful time we had at this restaurant.  Friends of ours have been raving about this place and so we all went together last night to have wine and appetizers.  DELICIOUS!!!!  Wonderful service and great selection of items to choose from.  I would highly recommend this place.  We will be going back.

Ate at Rooster's for dinner on a weekday around 6:00pm - we were seated promptly. The smells, oh the smells, when you walk in! You're greeted by a great smoky aroma, undoubtedly from the spinning spit fire roasted meats. We started with mussels, a special that day, which were great. We order mussels as an appetizer practically everywhere, and these lived up to our standards. I had the hanger steak, and my husband had the chicken, we also ordered the au gratin potatoes and haricot verts. Everything was great - though the highlight for me may have been the potatoes, I finished every last potato piece on the plate. They were truly decadent, and should probably be limited to a rare treat due to how creamy and cheesy they tasted.The haricot verts were also good, but slightly hard to eat because everything was served either on a very small plate or in a large, deep bowl, leaving no space to use to cut up the beans. Over all, very delicious and I'm sure we'll return!

Ate here this past week. Honestly didn't know that the place was even there. I was pleasantly surprised by the feel and friendliness of the staff. I had the burger with a side salad. Burger was on point salad was fresh not pre-made. Love the smell of the wood fire ovens. 

The only bad thing, I think they could do a better job of making sure there is enough bread on the table. We asked twice to have the basket refilled and it took a bit. The bread is made fresh in the ovens daily, and it's outstanding. 

This is a must place if you love wood fired food.

Enjoyed Sunday brunch here and really enjoyed sitting out on one of the patio tables. We had an excellent server and everything about our meal was very enjoyable; fresh, cooked well, and seasoned perfectly. We would like to come back and try dinner, but would highly suggest to friends for brunch.
Loved it!!!  Just found this place randomly and enjoyed the experience.  Staff and food were amazing!

I have heard great things about this place, including "Best Overall menu" from Charlotte Magazine.  So my boss and I went there for a business lunch to try it out.  It definitely smells wood-fired, which I found quaint and enjoyable.  The one thing I did not find enjoyable was the "Wall of Roosters".  I get it--the name is Rooster's; but McDonald's doesn't have shrunken Ronald heads all over the wall. It was a tad weird--and a few were staring at me!

I was going light, so I just had the Arugula and goat cheese salad, which was good. It was a salad--Mom won't hear about it, but I would order it again.

My boss had a burger, which he described as "fantastic" and had the potatoes au gratin as a side, which was a recommendation from our waitress.  He loved those, and was moaning through most of lunch.  

Our server was friendly and helpful, and since we were two of the only customers there, she was very generous with the water and bread.

I would definitely go back to Rooster's, and look forward to trying something more substantial next time!

Not impressed with this restaurant.  The calamari appetizer was greasy and the server didn't ask why we had her take away an almost full serving of the dish.  There were two Grouper specials on the menu, one was already sold-out.  According to the server they only had 4 orders available to begin with; this tidbit of information left us with the impression that the "special" was nothing more than a way to dump food scraps on customers at a high price.  The other Grouper dish was overly salted otherwise it could have been tasty.  The grilled shrimp entree was unimpressive and looked very lonely on a large plate with no accompaniments, as did the roasted chicken breast.  As a party of three we all walked away disappointed and felt the offerings were over-priced. We are reside in the Washington DC region and the SF Bay Area and are accustomed to pricy restaurants and don't object when the food is good.
Service was good but not able to say much about the food.  Menu is over priced for the food being served.  Don't think we will be going back any time soon.
Longest wait ever!!!!!!!!!!!! Wtf we had a reservation and waited over an hour

I recently ate at this Rooster's with a party of eight. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful the entire night. The food was fantastic. It is rare that everything that comes to the table is amazing, but that was the case. The seafood and other meats were all excellent.  Every side dish I tasted was cooked perfectly and flavorful. I have been numerous times, and I am never disappointed. I highly recommend this restaurant.

I am shocked this restaurant is not rated one of the best in Charlotte.   I have spent 3 nights in town and ended up eating dinner here all 3 nights.  Amazing service and food.  The service and staff are unprecedented.  They are very informative and solicitous to your every request.  Obviously chicken is the specialty but do NOT miss the Charcuterie plates or the desserts.  Out of this world!!
Recently had a outstanding dinner,  but do not order desserts, for some reason it always mediocre.

I was a little disappointed with Rooster's.  I ordered a Bloody Mary and it came w/o a celery stalk, just a wedge of lime.Mom ordered a white zinfadel and instead of saying they did not have it they brought a rose instead and said it was the sweetest thing they had!  A little insulting. We ordered our food then and the salads came quickly but they were finished and we waited a long time for our entrees. Finally asked the waiter and he said the kitchen forgot the hamburger which held him up.  Food finally came and all was good except the CORN that everyone raved so about....it was terrible.  Dry, overlooked and no flavor for $6 in a very little bowl.  It was also very noisy and hard to carry on a conversation.  Maybe best to go for a lunch date!

Amazing food, wonderful staff and good atmosphere. Loved the wine selection (even though I'm mostly a beer gal). The food was perfect. Totally recommend for a date night and can't wait to go again. It's family style with the sides and the protein choices are made for even the pickest eaters.

High level; good food, poor service, and oddly conceptualized menu. Took my family there on a Sunday afternoon. We arrived in time for the start of the dinner menu which worked well. However, when we went to order some of these dinner menu items, items such as the pizzas were not ready, along with a couple of the potato-based side items. Details of this were not disclosed when ordering, which was quite irritating. Which brings me to the service, which was extremely average for a 3.30pm on a Sunday afternoon. Drinks and food took along time to arrive, the menu was poorly explained, and just generally not very impressive. In addition, we had fruit flies at our table throughout the meal. When I mentioned this to our server, she said they knew about the issue but it was because of people opening the front door- interesting explanation I thought. My concern was apparently shared with the manager but no visit was paid to our table thereafter. Beyond that, the food was very good and had a nice ambience. I would suggest they decide what kind of the restaurant they are in terms of al a carte vs non al a carte since some dishes included sides and some didn't. For those that didn't, this was poorly explained and the side dishes were expensive and not particularly family style, as suggested by our server. Also, it was kind of odd receiving a breast of duck in a cold dish, without a plate to add sides to. While I'd recommend the food, there are far better restaurants for the price point, with better service.
The service was great!!! Mac and cheese and spinach was on point. If your a steak lover try the hanger steak.

Really enjoyed our meal there tonight.  All the dishes that we had were great especially the BBQ chicken and the short ribs.  The atmosphere was really nice. The service was excellent. It was obvious that others were enjoying their meals too.

My experience with roosters has lead me to this conclusion: The management and the owners of this restaurant are greedy and arrogant. They treat their staff with little to no respect from what I saw. I witnessed a manager yell at a young waitress till she cried. The food is decent, but way overpriced.

Rooster's is a locally owned Charlotte restaurant. The decoration is rustic with European influences- food is a mix of Spanish, French and Italian cuisine. They also try to incorporate local products/flavors into the menu each season. I've never had a bad experience here. The servers are friendly and attentive. Keep in mind that the portions are small (a la carte) 

Recommend: linguini and clams, sweet potato ravioli, farm fresh mozzarella salad

Just had the worst, greasiest, saltiest calamari ever. I typically like this place and eat here often. I've had their calamari before too. Never has the food been this awful. Must be new kitchen staff. Service from  the friendly bartender was great; which is why I offered the extra star.

The smoked wings are amazing! So incredibly good! Try them you won't regret it! The Mac and Cheese is also extremely delicious! My daughter ordered the kid's duck confit and loved it! We sat at the bar, the bartender was very helpful and friendly.
Excellent food  unique menu  my favorite

Their brunch game is pretty weak. Their brunch menu consisted of 4 or 5 items. Then they hand you their regular lunch menu.  The food we had was pretty oily and one note (our mozzerella pizza and grilled cheese sandwich). The tomato basil soup tasted off as well. I missed the anchovy spread on my ceasar salad. There was rock hard croutons and funky tasting black olives instead. I didnt have the best experience here food-wise. Seems too safe and plain. Will not be back.

I have to speak about this because it frustrates me when I read these reviews. I am so sick of hearing everyone complaining about how EXPENSIVE roosters is and the small portions..... This is absurd!  Im sorry that roosters does not have the same prices  and massive food portions as Applebees that most of you all must be used to who complain about the $ but give me a break. Roosters for the money, food quality and service is probably the best deal in town. You would spend 3 times your tab if you went to Del Friscos or Mortans downtown. 

To be able to have a very nice dinner for 2 for under 100 bucks in CLT with wine is a deal. 

STOP BEING SO CHEAP PEOPLE JEEEEZE

Rooster's is great for special occasions. Manager Yuri and server/bartender Jeff helped us put together a private event in the wine room. From first contact to the end of the party, the staff was attentive, courteous and professional. The food was delicious and pleasing to everyone, and drinks were fantastic. Thank you rooster's!

This review is for the Uptown location.

Lots of win here. 
Stopped in without a reservation to celebrate a friend's birthday.

Great, knowledgeable service, 
Warm, pleasant atmosphere, 
Worthwhile wine list,
Delicious charcuterie and cheese offerings ( Humboldt Fog, anyone?)

Definitely a welcome Uptown addition.

Went here for the first time to treat my husband for Father's Day dinner. We started with the calamari (delicious), I had the salmon and my husband the short ribs with au gratin potatoes and butter beans. My daughter had the sliders from the kids menu and enjoyed them as well. We will be back again, worth every dollar spent!!
Service is great, but food is ok.  We ordered the roasted chicken and a few other chicken dishes and they were ok.  3 stars because the service was great.

The restaurant is beatiful and in a great location but the service is very slow. It took a long time before the waitress even came to our table to introduce herself and take drink orders. Additionally, I ordered the chicken, their speciality dish and it was dry and bland. I could have made a better chicken dish at home which is very disappointing. Finally the prices are too high for the quality of the food.

Beautiful restaurant , nice atmosphere. engaging wait staff  disappointing food. My wife and I recently had lunch here and to be blunt I've had better sandwiches at takeout places in strip malls , in other words price didn't match presentation.We definitely expected a little more.

My mom and I came in for lunch today.  We had Geoffrey as a server.  My mom had ordered a bowl of soup & vegetable plate.  I ordered breakfast.  Everything was going great...and then we realized that our entrees were taking a while to get out.  We did not have to ask about our food.  The manager, Fernando (I think :) -- came to us and apologized on behalf of the chef saying that our food would be out momentarily.  Our food ended up having a 32 minute ticket time.  

I work in the restaurant industry and it is in moments like these that restaurants either SINK or SHINE.  ROOSTERS SHINED!!!!

I had a certain expectation of comps, but my expectations were exceeded when we were told that our entire meal would be comped as well as a complimentary dessert (which had not been ordered).

Kudos to a restaurant team that understands customer service and long-term vision.  We will DEFINITELY BE BACK!

The food was good and the portions were so large I had leftovers to 2 days.  Our waitress, however, left much to be desired.  Upon the server finally coming over to greet our table, I ordered a pomegranate martini.  The waitress asked me if I had ever had that drink there.  I told her I didn't recall.  She said she'd never seen it made there but wouldn't go check to see if it could be made.  Finally, my boyfriend asked her outright to go check.  She, of course, responded with a lot of attitude, and ten no surprise, the drink couldn't be made.  That set the tone for a lot of attitude the rest of the night from her.  I would have given 1 star based on the service, but the bread and water ladies were no nice and helpful, I gave 2.  

Bottom line, the food was alright, but don't ask for anything extra or risk the awful attitude we endured all night.
Great ambience, concept, and service. Had the salad-of-the-day (a bit simple), bbq pork shoulder (meh), smoked salmon (very good), and roasted beets (good).

A miserable experience from start to finish. Loud sports TV being broadcast in the bar where we waited and sipped the expected overpriced-yet-average wine. We were led to a table in a far corner from which we could view the delivery door being opened and closed. Then our waiter, who had either NO training or the worst sense of timing ever, strolled by to take our order after we'd been waiting, oh, 15 minutes or so. The food was bland, arrived haphazardly, was cold more often than not...you get the idea. And when we were ready for the check? You guessed it -- another 15 minute wait. I cannot fathom the appeal of this place.

Ate here for lunch over the weekend. Service was great!  No complaints there.  However, the food was a bit disappointing.  I thought the price should reflect a higher quality of food.  Ordered tomato soup bisque which was really good.  For the salad with scallops, the avocado that was on the menu as being a part of the salad, was actually guacamole blobs around the plate.  It tasted like they got too ripe so they blended it and squirted it on the plate.  The dressing wasn't bad, scallops were cooked pretty well but with only 3, I felt it needed a 4th to complete the large arugula portion.  My husband ordered the Vietnamese sandwich, which wasn't quite there either.  The pomme frites were on the larger side but a bit softer, not as crisp than I would imagine for pomme frites.  Overall, for the money, wasn't worth it to me and felt that Firebird's one block down had better food for the price.

Surprised by the good reviews on this place.  I had a Vietnamese pork sandwich with daikon. It was copied pork with bad BBQ sauce and coleslaw.  Been to Vietnam y'all. This isn't even close.  Service was slow.  Waitress did not speak English well enough to communicate with our table.  Questions were left unanswered.  Won't be coming back.
One of our favorite lunch spots in the South Park area. Get there early because it gets full fast!  Tomato Bisque soup is the best!

After my third visit to this restaurant, I think it will be some time before I return.  First of all, I find it more than a little off putting when the first words out of the waiter's mouth is "Would you like bottled sparkling or still water, or tap water"?  It's just plain annoying and seems to suggest that you're cheap if you don't spring for bottled water.  What it really says to me is "while you're here we'd like to wring as many dollars out of you as possible and if we have to make you feel uncomfortable while doing so , so be it.

We went for brunch today, and I was going to order the open faced serrano ham and cheese sandwich with mornay sauce until my waiter warned me that the portion is very small and that I might want to order some additional side dishes if I ordered it.  Given that he must have weighed 140 lbs soaking wet, I took him seriously and changed my order to the Southpark Fry:  duck confit hash, fried oysters, fried egg, and duck jus.  Sounds delicious, right?  It was merely OK and for $14 there should have been more than two small fried oysters and one ounce of duck confit.  There were more onions than anything else in this dish.  If this was a large portion, the ham and cheese sandwich must truly be tiny.

My wife had the "steak burger" and again we were annoyed at the small portion.  It was the size of a slider and completely unremarkable.

If you want to spend $40 on lunch and still come away hungry, Roosters is your kind of place.

Not as Good as I thought it was gonna be. The food was good but nothing special, especially for the price. Everything was a la carte and again the sides were not unique or special in anyway. I got two specialty drinks from the bar and they both sucked. Sent one back and didn't even finish the other. Our entrees were pretty good , my boyfriend got a steak and I got a salad, the dressing was delicious. The decor inside is cool and it's beautiful inside.

I can't believe no one here has mentioned the shrimp and grits...they are the best I've had anywhere...and I'm a foodie! I'm afraid to try shrimp and grits anywhere else because I know I'll be disappointed, and so far I've been right. My son won't visit me from NJ without going for shrimp and grits. AWESOME! Also their vegetables are wonderful!

I've been here 3 times while visiting my parents in Charlotte, and think it is great.  I don't think we've ever made a reservation, and have always been seated promptly.  One of those times was at a table near the bar, which was fun because the bartender was sommelier-ish and was able to recommend some delicious wines off their list.  Every time I've been, I've had the burger, medium rare (awesome).  The brussels sprouts, mushrooms, and asparagus are all great.  I've sampled the pork shoulder and it's very good.  I didn't find the prices to be particularly outrageous, but I don't have much experience dining in Charlotte, so I can't really speak to that.  All in all, I'd recommend going here if you're in the mood for some yummy wood-fired a la carte food.

If you enjoy great Southern cuisine ,this will be the place for you! the food is amazing...the service is perfect...and the ambience is excellent! I enjoyed the beef short ribs...and a wonderful arugula salad with feta..SO fresh!

Rooster's cares. They care about their food (local and sourced), the ingredients, fresh. They care about spices, people. They take care of you, patron or worker. The restaurant truly is a Southern jewel. The owner, kind hearted Christian Jim Noble. The manager, tender, evasively strong Fernando Derado. You ruin your experience in Charlotte if you don't come here.

~ex employee, 6 months separated, knows the value of a good restaurant in the South.

If I have someone coming to Charlotte for the first time, I take them here. 
It's a boisterous place with a central open kitchen and some damn fine food. Actually, the fries here are the best friends I've had anywhere. In the world. 
THAT good.
Making reservations ahead of time usually circumvents any wait time. If you want the Mother/Father's Day brunch - and you do - book it early. It's a wonderful brunch with so many good things on it. 
The menu at Roosters tends to be small. The lunch menu of sandwiches/burgers, salads, a couple soups (French onion is a standout), small pizzas and the like will please pretty much anybody. Dinner has a standard menu that has chicken, pastas and the like with 2 features every night. The fish selections are always wonderful. The other special can be a pasta, pork, beef - it's entirely seasonal and random. 
They will ALWAYS sell out. 
Roosters is not the place to go to at 10pm Saturday night and expect to find the trout with fiddleheads still available. The secondary menu feels like a letdown once the glamorous specials are out. 
So, what's the favorite thing here besides the fries? Pan roasted corn. Yes, really. It's a local thing and a roosters is known for their corn: peppery, buttery and good. 
The best thing here is something nobody else will want or notice, a totally overlooked menu item: on the children's menu is my son's most favorite dish ever: duck confit.
You can't go wrong with anything you order here. Jim Noble is the man.

I usually go there for lunch and I try to have something different each time. The basil pesto pasta was excellent, however, the chef is a stickler about keeping the menu items as is and not allowing for any changes. Even so, the ambiance is good and the food comes out fairly quickly.

Sometimes you enter a restaurant with certain expectations. Sometimes these expectations are derived from reviews online, sometimes friends' praises, and other times it's by coming upon the restaurant itself and gauging the quality of food simply through the interior design/ambience. Upon entering, and seeing the open kitchen right in the middle of the restaurant, I thought to myself, "I'm in for a scrumptious dinner."

The walls were adorn with a number of prismatic stuffed cocks, and everything else looked trendy and clean. The restaurant was so busy that there were no available seating inside the restaurant. So the four of us opted to sit outside instead. This restaurant apparently has a huge winelist. Were I a wine drinker, I would've appreciated it very much. Alas, I am not a drinker of wine due to a lack in a certain required sophistication, thus I did not appareciate the wine list. In fact it made the menu very confusing. Yes, I am dumb I couldn't figure out the menu at first. 

The menu items are moderately priced. $$ according to yelp  price range. The wait staff was attentive and got to our order fairly quickly. To start we ordered smoked salmon and fried oysters. The fried oysters came with a side of marinara sauce and the breading was perfect. The oysters itself was very fresh and juicy. The smoked salmon was smoked well and subtly flavored. The only complaint I have regarding the salmon is that it could've been chilled a little bit more. It was a little warm. Typically I like raw fish to be slightly colder. 

I ordered the Quarter chicken dark done natural style. They got me with their rotisserie chicken going round and round in the back of the chicken. Plus, with a name like Roosters, got to try their chickens. I also ordered a side of mac and cheese because my friend swore it tasted like it was made by our lord and savior JC.
 
I was not at all impressed with the chicken. In fact my first thought when I tasted it was, "Boston Market is much better" But, to give them credit, they use organic or locally raised chicken, so that does affect the texture of the meat making it slightly tougher than caged chicken. So that is excusable, however it was certainly lacking in flavor. 

The mac and cheese was good, but not mind blowing. One of my friends had onion rings. Those were some good onion rings. The breading was flavorful and the rings very thin and delicious. The spinach was very well done as well. My other friend had the mussels and he loved it. 

Portion size wasn't an issue because I wasn't all that hungry. 

I think this is one of those cases where I ordered the wrong dishes. I should try other, more exotic items like seafood or breaded dishes since their breading is so good. I'll update their rating next time I visit the restaurant. However, for now, I'll have to give them 3 stars.

Excellent. As newbies to the Charlotte area my fiancé and I are making our way through the more popular/well-known restaurants in town. We are using a list of Charlotte Magazine's 25 best local restaurants as a guide and Rooster's is near the top - so we gave it a whirl. We loved it. From the taxidermy roosters on the walls to the open kitchen, dimly-lit ambiance, and excellent food, what's not to love? We didn't have a reservation (which I'd recommend) so we sat at the bar (this is often our preference anyway so it was perfect) - we enjoyed excellent wine, ate the cured duck and creamy Chapel Hill cheese to start, and finished with gnocchi, pan-fried corn, and BBQ chicken. All-in-all an excellent meal made better by an excellent ambiance. We will definitely go back!

I came here twice, both in a small group hanging at the bar and as part of a larger one with a formal sit-down dinner. First the negative: the sit-down dinner was pretty bleh: mass-produced for mass capacity in the function room, which was kind of chilly. Hanging at the bar was better with appetizers and wine: try the calamari for sure. The wine-by-glass list was largely very decent and reasonably priced. But getting kicked out at 11 because the place was closing was a bit of a drag. This place gets super-crowded on Saturday nights, so they must be doing something right, but I'm not quite sure what that is, or what the whole stuffed cocks on the wall thing is (I mean roosters, you pervs!)
The chicken wings and the braised beef rib were very good. The service was great and it was a great atmosphere.

My husband and I visited Rooster's in South Park for the first time on Saturday night.

My first impressions of the restaurant were excellent. We had made a reservation via OpenTable, and upon arriving for our 7:30 reservation at 7:25PM, the hostess took one glance at her terminal after asking my name and said, "Your table is waiting, follow me." That's what I want to hear.

Once we were sat, however, it was a full 10 minutes before our server came to our table. After such a prompt seating by a hostess who conveyed gravitas and professionalism (she wasn't some college kid, which impressed me greatly) I was expecting promptness and seasoned professionalism throughout the place. 

Our waiter finally showed up, and didn't ask if we wanted to know the specials, or have any information for us. Instead, when I asked him about the beers on draft, he informed me that no beers were on draft (which is fine) and disappeared for another five minutes to get us a beer menu. 

He placed it with us, then left again, then returned to ask us if we had decided on drinks. We had, so we ordered them, and again he was off - with no inquiry about if we had any questions on the menu, and no offer to take our order. Yeah, I was hungry. Got a problem with that?

We finally got bread, and water, which I had trouble getting refilled. I also drink a lot, and drink fast (which yes, caused me problems in my college days). I found that water-filling staff members would  come and fill the water glasses of the newly-seated tables around us, without a single look at my empty water glass. Finally, I stopped one woman going to the table next to me and asked with my eyes and a nudge if she could spare some more water. 

Our orders were eventually placed and the food was good - very good. But the portions were small. The three stars are for the food, to be sure. My husband ordered the lamb chop special, which he very much enjoyed. He particularly enjoyed the mint sauce that came with it.

I ordered the hangar steak, cooked medium, and the pan fried corn. I received hangar steak, cooked rare. Fortunately, I can enjoy steak cooked along the spectrum from rare to medium well, so I didn't send it back. Besides, I had waited long enough for my food, I wasn't about to let my server take it back so he could have them re-cook it and risk the spit. So yeah, when he checked in I smiled broadly and said, "Everything is great!" as I ate my steak that mooed. The corn was good, but nothing I couldn't easily recreate in a cast iron skillet at home with a few ears of fresh corn and some butter.

This restaurant visit was a part of our "date night" so my husband and I enjoyed  the evening. The next day, my husband confessed to me that he was expecting more from a "wood-fired kitchen" - like, stuff that actually tasted like it had been cooked over a wood fire. Neither of our entrees had any smokiness to them. He had been itching to go to Firebirds, but we chose Rooster's instead because it was "new". Firebirds delivered more on the smoke when we last visited there.

We likely won't be going back to Rooster's for date-night in the future. The food was okay, but didn't wow me. The ambiance was "meh". The gem of the night was that fantastic professional hostess. I wish Noble could channel that excellence into the rest of the experience at Roosters.

I have to admit I was rather underwhelmed by Rooster's. Basically, the wood-fired roasted chicken wasn't anything I couldn't order from Harris Teeter. Not great, not terrible, either. And if I'm going to shell out big $$$ for a meal, I'd prefer to get my socks knocked off.

Still, the atmosphere and decor says a lot about Rooster's; I did like how spacious and roomy, and how quaint, the restaurant felt. I think it makes a nice place for a quiet date with someone. I'll probably try it again...soon-ish.

My family and I LOVE Roosters South Park and eat there often, even though its a hike from Concord! Had lunch there Wednesday and between my pork spare ribs, daughter's pasta and wife's spit-fired chicken we were once again pleased. We ate our roasted veggies too: corn and beets that day. Especially appreciated young manager Yuri stepping in to assist the wait staff...how did he know? He used to be a server, the second time we have experienced this connectedness (Steve is always great!) and proud of Jim Noble's staff promoting from within. Sometimes I go just to breathe the wood-fired air but the food is always excellent and we feel at home when we go!

We started off the night with the house caesar salad and the roasted chicken pizza. The caesar salad was decent but just a little light on the caesar dressing. Aside from the burnt crust the roasted chicken pizza was one of the better parts of the night. The toppings were flavorful and had it not been burnt it may have been an excellent pizza.

For her entree Ella got the Potato gnocchi with a rabbit confit. The gnocchi was light, fluffy, came with a really  delicious sauce and a crispy confit. Our only complaint with this dish was the ridiculously small size. For an $11 pasta we were expecting a full bowl that would be a hearty dinner. What we got instead was hardly big enough to be an appetizer.

I got the steak burger for my entree which may have been alright.. had it not been served nearly raw. When the waiter asked how I liked my burger to be cooked I replied " medium well "instead it came out juicy, red, and bloody with a light sear. I also got a side of Pan Fried Corn which was one of the better dishes of the night. My burger came with a side of onion rings which were greasy, lightly battered, and not worth finishing.

Ella got the Caramel Cake for dessert and after one bite declared it inedible. For my perspective it was extremely sweet and had the texture of pure butter. I went with the Chocolate Peanut Butter Crunch Cake with a scoop of vanilla ice cream because I wanted to compare it with the one we got at the Kings Kitchen a few weeks ago. The final verdict.. a lot of chocolate, not enough peanut butter crunch, and the ice cream melts way to fast to be enjoyed throughout the dish.

We didn't like Roosters much and for the time being can't recommend that anyone waste their time trying it. If you love it.. thats great, but for the creepy rooster wall, dim lighting, burnt food, raw food, and small portions we cant recommend it.

Wow. I came here for a lunch with colleagues and we tried a bunch of appetizers and different lunch dishes - it was all delicious. The manager didn't think I liked my salad, but I was just stuffed. Amazing food!! we had the calamari, pimento cheese, and wings. I also had the tomato basil soup and chicken spinach salad which was very good.

My husband and I stopped in there Valentine's Day around 5 pm. There was hardly anyone there and plenty of staff. The chicken wings were very good as was the salad. My low grading is due to the very unfriendly staff. We sat at the bar and we were acknowledged enough to place an order and pay the bill. Obviously we weren't looking for romance if we're sitting at the bar. We won't go there again.

When in Charlotte, I always go to Rooster's! I can always depend on excellent food and get excellent service from the hostess to the waitress to the entire staff. My wife and I have never had a bad meal or bad experience at this place. All appetizers entrees are superb but the coconut cake is to die for!

Already kinda biased because I have been to the one in uptown before so I already had high expectations and it didn't disappoint! The food is just consistently good and service is just as good! Came here for dinner Friday @ 8 made a reservation sat down after about a 3-5 min wait.  I was going to order one of the specials they had on the menu that night but they ran out :( so I settled on the wings! Not that it's a bad thing because they are really good! Honestly don't think you can have anything bad at Roosters! Becoming one of my favorites places to go to get a good meal!

Visited the Morrison Blvd location for lunch on a Tuesday. Really cool, clean, contemporary place that smells sooooo good. The wine bar is in a separate area and looks great too. Our server, Maurice, was very friendly and helpful. Good, but somewhat limited, draft craft beer selection that seems to rotate. They have more options in bottles. Falafel wrap was great and was a generous portion. My husband ordered the quarter chicken and enjoyed it (wasn't sure it was quite worth all the hype, though).  The side of beets was fantastic!

Roosters does good things to chicken! Their food style and decorations are like an upscale Cracker Barrel (minus the breakfast) - Half Chickens, Meatloaf, Pork Chops, Shrimp & Grits plus other Southern staples like pimento cheese appetizer and fried oysters! I'm a native North Carolinian, so these items please me greatly! The decorations are rustic farmhouse antiques like old butcher stands & taxidermy Roosters. And the food is served in small cast iron platters to add to the rustic charm. Today we went family style and ordered all of their most popular menu items. All of which were delightful and the seasonal gelato: Peppermint stick was the perfect finish to our feast..
Restaurant is totally over rated, overpriced chicken, expensive sides with average wine selections. Skip the smelly interior and go to BrickTops.
This is a great spot. Excellent service, delicious smells, great ambiance and a fantastic meal! Will surely be going back
Rip off.....tiny portions of average food at high prices, not a good combo.  Poor service to boot.  Very dissappointing

I eat here on a regular basis, probably at least five to six times per month (yes, we don't cook at home, so plent of opportunities for dining out each week). As a couple, or in a larger group, we've never had a bad experience at Roosters. I'm truly amazed that I have read some negative reviews. Everything is ala carte with reasonable prices. I don't usually eat chicken, but have had theirs, both regular and BBQ, and have found it to be exceptionally good. My favorites are the short ribs (very tender and flavorful) and the onion soup (incredibly rich). When it's offered, which is only when they can get a special local tomato in season, the BLT is absolutely wonderful. Service is exceptional, team approach with some taking order, others delivering the food. The roosters on the wall are interesting and a unique decor. An excellent choice for groups (they have a second set of tables across the hall) and I don't think you can go wrong eating here. My one negative is that the corned beef hash on Sunday brunch is not your typical hash, not bad, but not at all what I expected (so there, I can find some fault, but really had to work at it).

Food is good, but it is certainly not a value. Tends to be loud during lunch as well, so if you are planning a working lunch, bring your outside voice. Parking is better than most places on this strip.

Pricey for what you get- $8 salads & sides- even appetizers like 2 oz. of salmon -$8 with nothing else on the plate- no capers, crackers- nothing. 1/4 chicken (small) is only $10- but served with nothing. Food is good- but you'll leave hungry unless you get a salad, appetizer, entree, side.

I admit, I was a little scared/overwhelmed by all the taxidermied roosters on the wall when I entered the restaurant (Note: if you have a fear of birds, this may not be the place for you-- they literally have one wall ornamented with stuffed roosters). Our server Steve was the man..he may have been the best waiter I've ever had. He was so knowledgeable, fast, and friendly. The General Manager even came out to say hello. I had the cheese plate, the gnocchi (which was to die for), and the soft shell crab that had a panko crust. Everything was delicious. I would definitely come back!!

This is one of my favorite places to go on a date or when I am looking to treat myself. Everything is fresh and the presentation is always lovely. The service is some of the best I've had. I have had a waiter from the restaurant recognize me out on the street weeks later and say hello. The cheese plate is always a wonderful way to start the meal, the wines are wells priced and it is a lot of fun to share lots of small vegetable dishes. My fiance loves the duck confit and I am in love with their succotash and the macaroni and cheese. This is one of my favorite place to eat, I just wish I could afford to do it more often.

Lunch fried oyster salad and tomato soup bam! Dinner wood fired quarter chicken, fresh salad and excellent portions. When you see the decor you understand. It's tastefully done and quite impressive. I do believe the food and chefs are qualified to prepare anything off the menu that may suit you, menu changes daily with new fresh preparations thanks rooster

So everyone told me I had to try out Cowfish. Well with a 2 1/2 hour wait on a Saturday night (I should have expected that) we ended up going to Rooster's instead and I was not disappointed. 

Rooster's is an interesting place. We opted for sitting at the bar that looks into the wood fire cooking area. Twas a little warmer but we were famished and didn't want to wait for a table. Everything is a la carte so you have a good amount of options on what you can order. I'm a sucker for trying new cheeses so I was really close to getting the pick three option until one of the chefs in the cooking area told me you only get an ounce each. That would not do for my level of hunger. Instead I got the fire roasted chicken wings. I almost embarrassed myself for how fast I tore them apart. They were smoky, flavorful, and so delicious. Along with a side of spinach I was completely satisfied. 

One day when I'm rolling in the dough I'll come back to this place to enjoy all the things I wanted on the menu...aka all the cheese!

So Glad we chose to eat at Roosters.  My wife has Celiac Disease so eating out, although easier these days, still a gamble for "Gluten-free Restaurants".  After looking in Yelp at the reviews we were pretty comfortable in our decision.  We loved it from the moment we walked into the door.  Great atmosphere with the Rustic Vibe and open concept kitchen..   our server was phenomenal giving us the right amount of time to decide.  His suggestions and concern for our allergies were his number priority.  
The food??   Phenomenal.  I ordered the Pork Loin special and my wife the Duck. The kids ordered the Burger, the 1/4 Chicken and the Bisque.  For sides we had the potato's, grilled corn, beets and fries.  Everything was absolutely delicious!   
Thanks Rooster for the out of town experience!   We'll visit again for sure, when in North Carolina again

Probably one of the best diners I've ever had in Charlotte.  I ordered the beef short rib and fried corn;  both were off the charts.  Great setting and the host was wonderful!  The dinner party I was with all agreed this place is very special.  Thanks for a wonderful evening!
Great Lunch menu, horrible dinner menu and they take forever to serve you food, especially if you have a togo order. It took me 45 minutes to get my order and they knew I was waiting at the bar.

For the past year & a half this place has been my standby for dinner after arriving at CLT airport.  Food is much better than the chain type places nearby... however, last few times I've been there I've left a bit disappointed.  I was there two nights ago & felt the food was overseasoned which is hiding the true flavor.  

Service is always very friendly & accommodating.  Next time I'll remember to ask for dressing on the side & steamed veggies unadorned.  Yes, there are folks that can't survive without salt... give them a salt shaker.   With the awesome Charlotte Farmers market nearby... let the veggies speak for themselves.

I find lots of fried and "smothered" options on plenty of southern menus.  Roosters needs to be a gourmet cut above to match the price & service.  They've hit the mark before & they can do it again  You can definitely do worse in the neighborhood.

Hey Roosters folks, the common them thru most of these neg. reviews are portion size...do u read these at all?..I've seen similiar complaints on other social sites....most folks aren't looking for a Golden Corral hog trough buffet to gorge themselves, but enough to come close to justify the prices you charge. If I order range-fed chicken, I don't expect the whole bird, but i DO expect more than a baseball size piece of meat with artistic drawings/arrangements on the plate for $15. You consistently get some of the worst reviews of any Southpark eatery..WAKE UP before you CLOSE UP!

Rooster not to be confused with Chef Marcus Samuelson restaurant Red Rooster in Harlem, NY is a refreshing take on Southern open kitchen dining with a refreshing menu and true Southern hospitality staff.
While in SouthPark the family and I usually steer toward the typical four restaurants and one day we decided to randomly select and try something different after shopping and Yelp popped up Rooster and we said since it was first in the results we would try.
Today marked our second visit and each time we were HAPPY. Our first visit yielded memorable items in which we repeated one of them = the dessert of desserts Coconut Cream Cake. This cake is not your typical cake it's cool in temperature and extreme in flavor with layers of awesomeness and a MUST HAVE.
Our FAVORITE apps include the avocado toast it's so flavorful with cilantro and pickled red onions and the fried oysters. The oysters are fried to perfection and the sauce is full of flavor. This place is one of the very few places that give you a nice amount of fried oysters in your order which is a plus.

Tonight I tried the grouper over fingerling potatoes and a confee which was tasty, the potatoes and veggies more than anything because the fish was sorta over cooked but still tasty. If it was cooked a little less it would've been perfect. My hubby had the hanger steak which he wasn't too impressed with its flavor. He did however enjoy his duck tenders and the roasted corn side it was amazing.
I Love the decor and have me thinking if all those roosters on the wall are real stuffed roosters Hmmm. Well if so cock a doodle do LoL

Great place with friendly staff

Coincidentally, good friends of mine were passing through Charlotte during one of my moves.  They offered to help and, in return, I offered to take them out to someplace really nice.  We picked Rooster's because (a) it was new, (b) I had wanted to try it, and (c) it was fairly close to my new home.  

We were all pretty tired from packing, moving, and cleaning all day (me, most of all), so it felt like a load had been lifted off my shoulders when we walked into the fairly dimly lit Rooster's and were immediately seated without a reservation.  My only shock came when I discovered that the menu items were all offered a la carte, and no one item was all that cheap!  I let that pass, though, thankful for my friends' help and hoping that we'd have an excellent meal.  Turns out, we did have an exceptional meal.  Every a la carte item we ordered was delicious, starting with the soups and breads, and finishing with dessert.   It was about $200 (for a party of four, with drinks) that was well-spent, considering what the cost of movers (and/or my time and patience) could have been.  

I'd love to go there again, but with the pricing for each item, it's going to have to be another very special occasion before I return.

Oh my...save your money folks.  Had a reservation... STILL had to wait 20 minutes... with no where to wait....the bar was full so we stood at the door getting in peoples way. The waitress and the hostess were as nice as could be... unfortunately it didn't make up for the MICROSCOPIC portions of food we got for dinner.  Honestly, I don't think I have EVER been to a restaurant with portions this tiny.....  I think they are catering to gnomes.  It wouldn't have been so bad if it wasn't so expensive, but it was VERY overpriced for what you get... the food was ok.... sorta tasty, but my dinner was a bit salty, my husband and daughter had the tiny microscopic Hanger steak, which they liked, but again, we walked out starving. There are too many great places in Charlotte to eat where you can get you're money's worth.  Go there instead.

I went on a Saturday night with a few girlfriends.  We didn't have reservations so they put us at the "Chefs Table" which is the bar surrounding the kitchen.  We loved it! I would definitely recommend making reservations to have a normal table for next time, but it was fun to watch all of the food being cooked and the kitchen interact.  I ordered the Mushroom Fregola which was delicious! Our waiter was attentive and they always made sure we were doing well and our waters were filled even though we were kind of in the back corner.  I would definitely recommend and return to this restaurant!

After trying to come to lunch a bit late the other day, we were finally able to hit this place during lunch hours. Lunch ends around 3-330p, so make sure not to go to lunch too late like we did. 
The atmosphere when you walk in is very comfortable. The smells are divine coming out of the open roasters. While casual, it has a rustic classy feel. All of the interior is very well themed and compliments the rustic-style rotisserie foods. 
Service was on point. Our server checked in appropriately and refilled waters without being asked. Though not up to our server, our food came out quickly even though the restaurant was relatively busy.
My partner and I shared the arugula, chevre, and peach salad. The salad was very fresh and had a good summer feel. The peaches were not very acidic which paired well with the vinaigrette. When the salad was delivered, the runner asked if we would like fresh cracked pepper. We should have done so, as it was definitely a flavor I felt would have helped break down some of the vinaigrette. The vinaigrette wouldn't have been an issue if there had been a touch more chevre as it was the counter balance, but the chevre was extremely sparse. An ounce more would have been perfect.
My partner and I shared two different sandwiches, one being the chicken, gruyere, roasted garlic balsamic and the other being the spit roasted turkey breast with bacon. I'll start with the chicken. The chicken was moist and the balsamic was perfect. However, when it came down to the gruyere it was hard to find. When we opened the sandwich, there was very little. We weren't sure if this was intentional or not, but in both areas that there were cheese it was lacking. 
The spit roasted turkey was fresh, crisp, and refreshing. I opted out of the mayo (I'm not exactly sure who would put mayo and avocado on the same sandwich, but that just seems like overkill to me) which was a good choice. I felt that the turkey lacked seasoning as the chicken on the other sandwich had been so flavorful. This is a personal preference as my partner did not agree, but I would have rathered wheat instead of white bread. 
Both of us got fries on the side, and while a bit overly salted, the hand cut fries were crisp and fresh. 

All in all, we'll definitely be back. I wanted to try their lunch before diving into dinner and I fully anticipate returning soon.

Went here on Saturday night and this time the server Stephanie did an amazing job!! We were with two people that had never been and they loved it as well!! I don't know what they changed but whatever it is it's working!!
The best barbecue chicken and Mac/cheese and the veggies. I really would go back tomorrow!!!

Following a recommendation, we stopped in at Rooster's during our short stay in Charlotte. I was not disappointed.

We had the NC BBQ Pork Shoulder and the Roasted Duck Breast. I very much enjoyed both dishes. The pork shoulder was very tender and coated just right with seasonings, spices, and bbq sauce. However, the duck breast was the real star of the show. Juicy on the inside, crispy on the outside. They managed to perfectly capture that good ol' rich & oily duck taste into those morsels. Potatoes au-gratin and the wilted spinach were our sides. They were good, but not much to write home about there. 

If I'm ever back in Charlotte I will definitely be looking to stop by here again.

Ahhh Roosters, where did you go wrong? Why am I giving you only two stars? Because, frankly, with the exception of the pan roasted corn and the wine list, you deserve 2 stars. Ugh.

Yes, the portions are small, and so when you add up enough things to get full, suddenly you parceled together a $24 meal.  But I just have a problem with the execution. I've been twice for dinner and twice for lunch. Their grilled salmon was burnt and not tasty. When I got a salmon salad on top of frisee, red peppers and fingerlings, the salmon was almost pure fat and tasted awful and I walked away hungry. 1/5  The pizzas are tiny.  Oh, the fries are actually quite delicious.  I'm just not clear why my friends like it so much.  Next time, I would just go to sit outside, have a glass of vino and maybe munch a little on the corn. 

Chef Noble, all my love for King's Kitchen, but this one misses the mark consistently for me.  Regrettfully,
Jules

We made reservations for 5 on a Sunday afternoon .ended up being 4 of us.  Dining with my husband & niece & nephew. They gave us a large corner booth . We decided to share our food so we could try a little bit of everything. I'm glad we did! Ordered the Crostini bread with their pimento cheese, the dry rubbed chicken wings & the tomato basil soup.  The pimento cheese & bread was great! We used the soup almost as a sauce . Lol I had the shrimp & grits ( which are the large fluffy hominy ones btw) nice husband got the meat loaf he is particular about but said this was very good . Others got a hamburger &  the spit roasted chicken is large , tender & tasty! The atmosphere is cool with a open kitchen concept. The wait staff & management are attentive ! There is a wall celebrating Rooster's of all breeds. So vegans might not appreciate but I get it & thought it was quite unique . There is an enclosed courtyard area? Did take pics at this place ( sorry should have! ) atmosphere is relaxed rustic with some antiques . Tip- at brunch you can order eggs & things that aren't on the menu. Just ask

My little sister's birthday dinner choice. Lots of small portions (not cheap) very nicely presented with a nice selection. OK lots of roosters -and a pheasant- on the wall with high ceilings and dark wood mixed with stone for atmosphere. I thought it was nice. 
My sister went for the Gluten Free menu and had the Rooster wings which were so tasty that I wasn't offer even one! I had the chicken fried woods mushrooms ( a bit bland but the dipping sauce was great.) My sis's husband had the onion soup which must have been good 'cause nobody was offered a sip and it was gone is 60 seconds. He had scallops for main course (4,) quite rich. I had a chicken quarter. Everything was elegantly served, the wait staff was very attentive, the deserts were something (my sister's pear sorbet was exceptional.)
A nice dinner can easily exceed $50 per person, but  it qualifies as a culinary experience to be properly savored- not just a meal.

Our first time to Roosters for an evening out with friends and we were not disappointed. We made a reservation by phone earlier in the day and we're seated right upon arrival. 

Our waitress was Kelby and she did a great job going over the menu, making suggestions and giving us time to decide and order. 

We ordered quarter roasted chicken, fried oysters, and 2 bbq meals along with onion rings and green beans (called haricot verts) and it was all good. The chicken is what I had and it came in a small cast iron pan and was super moist and seasoned well. The 2 guys ordered the bbq, and I had read in another review that the meat was cubed, but it still seemed strange. It wasn't as plentiful of a portion as I would've expected.  Hubby said the flavor was good but nothing spectacular.  The fried oysters were a hit and the onion rings were thin and crispy, my favorite! 

We ordered 2 desserts to share, the coconut cake which I HIGHLY recommend and the chocolate mouse pie which ai didn't sample. The coconut cake was light, creamy and just really good!

The price points matched the Southpark area, the decor was adorable and the ambience was casual but still super nice dinner night out for us. 

We would recommend it!

My wife and I love this place! hey have some of the best cheese and cured meats to start with. The wine list is great also so plenty to choose from to pair with your meal. The specials are always delicious and the portions are generous. Definitely put this place on your radar.

This place is the best food, service, and atmosphere in town. Waitress was extremely knowledgeable and gave great recommendations. We had a large group and had about half of the appetizers and then shared the sides as well since it's an a-la-cart type place. It's a little on the pricey side, but worth every penny.

The food and wine is great! We tried the duck, scallops, burger and chicken. They were all perfect. The spinach and asparagus was also very nice. Would definitely come back to try more. Everything was seasoned nicely. Had an amazing waiter. He allowed us to taste the wine before we purchased the bottle. Great for a date night or a ladies night.
Roosters was a very good experience. Service, ambiance and food! Extraordinary! We live 700 miles away and Roosters was worth the drive!!!

Just got back from dinner at Rooster's. While I have had their lunch several times, this was my first time having their dinner. It did not disappoint!

I had the Caesar salad and bowl of tomato soup. My boyfriend had the steak burger with butter beans. Everything was delicious. We ended the night with the coconut cake. My boyfriend doesn't even like coconut and even he loved it. It's worth it to visit just for the cake!

The service is good here. I like that they take their time. But I could see how some people feel it is on the slow side. There was no need to make a reservation when we went- we walked in on a Monday night and were seated immediately! 

Ambiance is good, but the birds aren't for everyone! Overall great experience.

One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. There is nothing I've tried that I did not like. All the food is delicious. Personally I love their short ribs and bbq chicken. It's easy for everyone at the table to try each other's dishes. Warm and welcoming atmosphere. Great service. Highly recommend.

We walked in on a Wednesday night to try this place out. At first we were greeted with a semi-snooty "do you have a reservation?" which is fine to ask but you don't need to look down on me because we made a last minute decision to dine at your establishment. And, for the sake of being honest, the lack of the last star is because of this initial greeting. A second hostess appeared and the attitude disappeared and we were shown to a nice booth. 

We sat for a few minutes and had the chance to decide what we would like to drink from their pretty impressive wine by the glass list. The wine I originally ordered was out but the substitution was delicious so no big deal there! 

We placed an order of wings to have as an appetizer and they were delicious. These are not soaked in buffalo sauce dip them in ranch dressing wings, they are dry rubbed and smoked and the flavor is amazing. 

For mains I went with the burger and fries and the husband had the salmon and a side of the corn. First, let me say that he was kind enough to share a couple of bites with me so I could taste his and even though I'm not a big fish person I thought the salmon was really good as was the corn. The burger was delicious! Seriously, one of the best I have had in a really long time and the fries were also so good! 

The service was spot on and we're really looking forward to going back and trying more menu options. The patio seating looked really nice but I have recently quit smoking and there were people smoking at those tables so I'm not sure we'll be able to enjoy that anytime soon.

Omg, gimme some more of that duck.

Place was on point, service was great, food was too, top notch expierence,

Went for a private xmas company party, and they had no problem accommodating us, (30+),  we totally booked in advance too (please dont expect to walk in with 30+ unannounced") tho i bet you they would have problem if you did.  

Their service staff rocked it out; drinks on time, attentive, and super polite and friendly,  what more can you ask for,

Food,
Man, everything that came out was on point.  Tasty, warm and all was well seasoned, no complaints.

Not gonna lie, duck confit... gotta give it a try, pretty legit.  

And the bread pudding too for dessert...omg, its a southern staple, and they completely nailed.  Not gonna lie, i licked my plate,

Overall,
Job well done guys, 

This place had been a staple in the Charlotte area for quite some time, and i totally understand why now.  Only wish would of come here more when i lived here, 

A++ guys, well done.

Great service, lovely wine selection and decant food. I had the cheese board & hanger steak...it was even plenty to share. The hanger steak was cooked perfectly. 
Definitely a great restaurant in the Southpark area.

Great place to go when on your own. Sit at the bar frequently when busy, have sat at tables as well with friends, and just a great experience all around. French onion soup and wings are amazing. The coconut cake is beyond delicious...no words to explain. Staff are always friendly and accommodating whether a party of one or 10. Nice walk from Piedmont Row Drive so hopefully burned off a few calories consumed!

This was one of the worst dining experiences I've ever endured! I had the hanger steak, it was prepared perfectly, medium, great marinade, but came to the table ICE COLD! With the exception of the Mac n Cheese the sides were below par! Every time we would order a beer from the drink menu the server would leave, come back and say "we're out of that beer"! We spent $300 for an evening experience that was truly forgettable! Giving this place 1 star in overly generous!

Chef John approach to using farm to table ingredients is displayed in the presentation and bold flavor of the a la carte choices of the menu. My sister and i came here from recommendation of previous yelp reviews and was pleasantly surprised with our choices. On the table we had smoked wings which was delicate vinegar smoke flavor with dry rub spice that blend well that had us licking fingers. We also enjoyed the chef special duck that was marinated in salt pepper sugar and its duck fat juices overnight. The duck was tender and full of flavor.  The next dish we had was one of the regular dishes  chicken that is rotisserie in the huge Italian brick oven and glazed over with light bbq sauce  that was a great combination of sweet and tangy. To complete our delightful  meal we had four sides smash potato, spinach , roasted beets, grits, and mac and cheese. All the sides had unique twist that only chef John could create that made the sides standout on there own. 
I was surprised how this resturant used simple ingredient and farm raised quality meats and veggies to make a menu with so much depth and variety that I will definitely be back to try other options on the menu.

This place was wonderful! 

My boyfriend and I went for a late dinner last night and loved it. We waited about 20 minutes for a table but it wasn't too bad, we grabbed a drink at the bar and then the table was ready. 

First of all almost everything is A la cart so know you're going to spend money. We started with the charcuterie and had them pick what was on it. I'm so happy we did that we got some things we wouldn't have picked ourselves. My boyfriend got the chicken which of course being called roosters they're known for. He got the chicken BBQ style which had an Indian influence not a traditionally BBQ but he really enjoyed it. He also got a side of Mac and cheese...which was amazing! 

I got the mussels  which came with toasted bread and it was salty and delicious. I got a side of fire roasted beets and onion rings. Both were amazing. 

All in all the experience was delightful and our server was so friendly and helpful. We would go back in a heartbeat.

I was sent out to get a to-go order for my office. Everyone was a fan! Portions are light, but seemed to be enough to suffice. They were nice enough to write everyone's names on the lunches. THANK YOU ROOSTERS. I've also been there for dinner which was also nice.
Been enjoying Roosters since it opened and still love eating here. A great place to take out of town visitors too!

This is the most stellar restaurant in Charlotte. It is my go-to place for great cheese, amazing wood-grilled meats, and good wine. The waiters really know their stuff. Try the duck confit or hanger steak for entrees and macaroni and cheese or corn for sides.

Still a favorite! Had lunch here last week.

Loved the grilled cheese and tomato bisque and the coffee.. OMG, to die for! Wish I could have taken a bunch of beans home, but my suitcase was seriously already like .2 from being overweight at 49.5 lbs....

I eat here about 10 times a year and I had not had anything but a good experience. The food is always good. I love their: oyster salad (fresh and non greasy oysters), burger and fries (great fries), fried chicken livers (if you do not like liver try theirs it is soft deliciousness encased in a perfectly fried batter).
As far as service goes I have only experienced professional service and on more than one occasion I remarked how well run the place was. 
I tend to have lunch here so my comments may not apply to dinner; at lunch it is a good buy (entrees about $8 - $12). For dinner try Zebras, Carpe Diem, Barringtons, Gallery all of which offer an upscale dinning experience for an upscale price. Sorry for any misspelled names.

Wow!  Grilled meatloaf with seared spinach, sweet potato purée and fried onions.  Portions were perfect!  Flavors worked well together even when plated in porcelain coated cast iron serving pans. Deserts were not an option, we were so full from the lunch meal . #13 on Charlottes Best Restaurants for 2017, it is there for a reason!!

We had a birthday dinner for a friend at Roosters. The ambiance and atmosphere there is great. However- the service was lackluster and the food was so/so. The waiter was slow and was too into the food and menu. He was also very introverted and kept to himself and was soft spoken. The food was fine- not bad but not great. Most things are ala carte- I had a pizza and my date had quarter chicken. I'd go back- but it's not a favorite spot of mine by any means.

Calamari- was good with the dipping sauce but the batter they fried it in was beyond salty

Mac and cheese- cheesy, a little on the salty side, but overall some good mac

Half chicken- definitely recommend getting it with the bbq sauce it was very tender and juicy

scallops- nothing special a little undercooked in my opinion

coconut cream cake- so good but a little too sweet for me 

our server was great though and was happy to make suggestions and explain the menu for our first time. probably will be back to try some of the other stuff on the menu, it seems like a creative menu just on the pricier side

Fantastic fire roasted BBQ chicken! It was fresh and juicy. 

Something I didn't like however was the price and menu options. There were very few food options (I'm pretty sure their wine list was longer than their dinner menu). And $11 for a piece of chicken with no sides? Seems a bit extreme. Even for a high-end restaurant.

We didn't even get any bread before the meal, although I did see another table who did.

This is our second trip to this location and it is subpar compared to the Uptown location. On this trip, most of our food was heavily covered in ground pepper. A place that has food like this should not use chefs who seem dependent on pepper. All of the flavors of the dishes (strip steak, peas, spinach, onion rings) were completely lost due to the amount if ground pepper. Another small thing, but they seem unable to produce a glass of Diet Coke that isn't flat or taste like an odd mix between regular and diet. The staff has been great - other than the guy who breezed by and asked how we were enjoying things but didn't care about our response as he kept going and responded as if we gave a glowing "yes" in reply. 

I will be sticking to the Uptown location and trying out the Ballantyne location. This is my last visit to this location.

A Very Unique CLT institution, but pricey!

Went last night on corporate event. Best Calamari ever! Fried Corn, Brussel Sprouts were pretty good. Assorted Mushrooms ($10) were AMAZING.

I ordered NY Strip "medium", and was served overcooked steak... twice. Manager came out to apologize. Interesting that they couldn't get that right. Despite me ordering $29 entree, they comped 2 desserts.

Coconut Cake and Bread Pudding were top hits.

Check Out the Bar Bites Menu (after 4pm). Very good selection, $5-7/dish

I really enjoyed lunch here!  The place was fairly empty. I had a little pizza and it was about 6" in diameter; just right for me but not my husband. I loved the French onion soup. Service was very good!  I asked for some chopped fresh basil and she came back empty. Weird for a place that makes pizzas!

Visited on a Sunday for brunch over a holiday weekend.   They, like most of Charlotte, we're very quiet with many traveling.  This worked to our advantage with stellar service and impeccably prepared food.  Lori's french onion soup was excellent with a deep, umami flavor.  My order of chicken livers over polenta was, quite frankly, one of the best riffs I've had on this overlooked,  rustic culinary treat.  I kicked it up a notch with a 3 minute poached egg which ran all over the plate.  Mmmm.  Perfect.  I paired it with a glass of prosecco to give it a little elegance.  

Other than smelling like a campfire when I arrived home (which I liked), I was happy we visited.  A return is in their future.

***edit.... I did give it three stars. That was until an employee or chef from roosters in Charlotte made a yelp profile "steak r" to email me and call me an idiot for pointing out how shitty the salad was. What a douche. LOL. ****

***they contacted me a second time to call me names for editing my review to reflect their harassment***

This place was just ok. I went there for a business lunch (I live in NYC)... got a cobb salad and the whole thing was deconstructed... like lettuce in one part, cheese, bacon, all like 3 inches away from each other on the plate. This place isn't new american.... they have no business turning a standard lunch salad into what they think is going to be avant-garde masterpiece. Our waitress was very nice, the service was fast and welcoming. But the food is average.

I've worked in the restaurant industry for 15 years, four of which have been spent here at Roosters... hands down, one of the BEST restaurants out there. The food is simply amazing. I always tell my guests to start with the charcuterie board. The selection is great and it's always served with mixed olives, crostinis and a housemade black grain mustard (goes the best with the duck ham). For dinner, you have to order the seared sea scallops or the boneless beef short rib. If you want something a little less formal, the smoked wings are delicious. They are seasoned with a dry rub and smoked. They are then prepared in the open flame brick oven for a nice crispy skin- so good! For sides, don't miss out on the succotash (fresh corn sliced from the cob and sautéed with butter and salt/pepper mixed with butter beans that have been reducing in a chicken stock). If you want to indulge in some comfort food, go for the Mac n cheese or the augratin potatoes. A perfect ending to any meal is the coconut cake. I'm not even a fan of coconut and yet I LOVE this cake. You will not be disappointed!

Simple and tummy happy garden to table comfort food.  Rotisserie chicken was good, fried oyster was great and coconut cake and MAC and cheese was awesome!
Wonderful meal over all.  Great service too.  Highly recommended.

Rooster's is one of the more consistent and enjoyable venues in Charlotte. They succeed in food, aesthetics, alcohol-related needs, and service.

Tall ceilings. Open atmosphere. A diverse menu crafted with care. Full bar with house cocktails that honor trends and blaze trails at the same time. 

The bar is long. Bar tables are long, high tops of stately wood often shared with other patrons.

In the dining section, many booths and wall tables providing a booth-like privacy add to the charm and splendor of Rooster's.

Rooster's menu varies often because they focus on what is fresh and available, and what is in season. I've not loved every dish I have tried, but that's a matter of personal taste rather than quality or preparation.

Dined here with friends for Sunday brunch. Large open space with roomy booths, which makes for a very comfortable and intimate dining experience.

I had the shrimp and grits. Delicious! There's a bit of a spicy kick due to the chorizo...fun for the taste buds! My husband got a traditional breakfast. Good, but nothing extra special. Like others have mentioned, the portions are not large; however, it was plenty to get me full (not stuffed).

The service was good and everyone seemed very friendly. The decor is a conversation starter with a wall of stuffed roosters. 

It is pricey, so going is a luxury when you can.

My husband always talks about this place but for some reason we never went together until this past Sunday. I had to get something at the mall and we didn't feel like eating at the food court. So my husband mentioned it and we decided to check this one out. Since the one he always goes is in another location. 
We got there around 4pm, they were not busy and we were sat right away. 
We decided to sit outside because the weather was nice and the afternoon was pretty charming.
We decided to split half of chicken with a side of mac and cheese. 
The food got ready pretty fast.
I am not a big fan os Mac and cheese, maybe it is because wherever you go the Mac and cheese will always be different, however always blend. But this time for my surprise and happiness the Mac and cheese was wonderful! So cheesy and creamy.... Tasted like  real Parmesan cheese! The chicken came in a sauce that looked like butter and was really great!
I keep dreaming about that mac n cheese, it is 10$ for a small side but it makes every penny worth it!
Our waiter was really friendly and attentive.
