With that being said we will definitely be back for more :)

I LOVE this place. I always come by when I'm in town, more for the atmosphere than the food. I'm not a big Southern foods fan, but definitely try the vegetable plate. Mac and cheese, roasted beets, corn, onion rings are fantastic.  The BLT isn't on the lunch menu, but with heirloom tomatoes, fantastic bread, and thick-cut bacon, this is hard to pass up. I also adore the chicken, arugula and apple salad at lunch. The service is amazing and the wine list is fantastic. Let your waiter talk you into a Spanish wine on the list or take part in the $2.50 glass during the week-such a great deal!

I had a great lunch here today! The grilled chicken sandwich was very good, love the onion jam on it. The pan fried corn is delicious, perfectly sweet and salty. The Mac and cheese was excellent. The cheese flavor is smoky and strong, love it! We will definitely be going back soon!

I love the ambiance of this place! So cool and modern, different from normal. The food is all good. Went with a friend and my family. The food is decently priced-- like a nice restaurant but not overkill snotty pricing. The wine we had was decent. Weird that it's in a strip mall, we had trouble finding it at first, but I would definitely go back here and take other friends.
Food was way too salty, never had such a salty steak in my life. Service was not great . Would not recommend

Man-o-man!  I really do like this place.  We went with another couple for dinner, later took 97 year old dad there for lunch and two more times for dinner and lunch.  Very consistent and very good.

Sad to report that I have yet to try their namesake wood-fired chicken.  Too many other interesting and nice menu options that push chicken lower on the list.  I will eventually get there.

I can't remember the name of the dish...sorry, but it was a mix of mushrooms and chicken (ooops!) in a baking dish like a stew.  Rich, creamy and delicious.  And there is magic in the mixed mushrooms served as a side or appetizer.

The short rib is so yummy that you eat slowly to extend the ecstasy.  On the mashed potatoes!  Aaaaaaahhh!! 

Salads, from side to main course are generous and their dressings are made in-house so are wonderful.  Onion soup is as it should be:  rich, cheezy and hot.  

Service is great.  Wait staff have personalities, not over-done, and relate to the people at the table.  And they are more than willing to arrange substitutions (within reason, please) and accommodate likes and minimize dislikes.  And when there is an issue, they simply replace the item and don't charge you.  Nice.

They do a good job here, so give lunch a try, and come outside of prime time when it is not so crowded.

We order off the local menu everything is delicious. 

Short ribs are excellent 
Corn
Green beans
Bummed they were out of the fried okra!

This gal from LA would come again!

Ken is awesome. Sweet man and very polite server. If you happen to go here for a late lunch or just wasting some time, go here and ask for Ken. I came in on a lazy Sunday just planning to waste some time and enjoy a nice atmosphere. I sat at the bar by myself. First thing I didn't like was that they didn't have sangrias. The manager told me that they didn't even have merlot. After looking at the drink menu, they did have merlot by the glass. Officially don't like him. Ken came over and served me. I ordered a small Ceaser salad and some smoked wings. Salad was different but gourmet. The wings were great!  Come in after 4pm for $6 wings. The menu is fairly small but the food taste is Worth the lack of selection. I might not come back for a dinner date but if I want to waste some time at the bar, I'll ask for Ken.

This is 3rd time I ordered something to go from here for lunch but the first time I really decided to say something because usually I just get a side item to go. 1 piece of chicken and a small side order of succotash should NOT cost $19.50 including tax, Quality of food is good but chicken honestly no better than roasted one from grocery store except it does have an interesting smoke flavor to it. The lunch menu was no cheaper than the dinner menu & just had a few less choices. The 1/4 chicken was $11 & 1/2 chicken was $14- that is without even 1 side!! I thought for that price that the servings would at least be more than plentiful but that was not the case. Yes, it was plenty for one person but the price is just outrageous, truly. My suggestion would be to have combination plates nor significantly increase serving sizes to at least give the impression of value. Also not impressed with having to wait at bar in order to get to go menu.There is curb side pick up but I preferred to go in & get it & not pay a tip for simply getting take out.

Came with for a quick lunch one day! Had the lunch special ... Nc bbq chicken sandwich... With sweet potato fries!! It was delicious ... I left nothing on the plate. Affordable lunch menu prices! Definitely will come back for dinner!!

Had the pleasure of dining at Rooster's for dinner with colleagues. I've always been a fan of mushrooms, but I never knew they could be as delicious as they were in the wild mushroom appetizer. The duck breast entree was also exceptional.

I have no idea how many times I have eaten here. I think that there is an imprint of my bum on my booth 2 away from the kitchen door. I always start with the arugula salad, then either the veggie plate or the spit fire turkey sandwich (best sami in town), butter beans, and the coconut cake. OMG the coconut cake has a creamy vanilla englaise they drench over it. It is so good. About the butter beans. This is a big thing for me. If you've never had them you need to try them. They are amazing and so good for you. This is something Rooster's does so well. If you have a vegetarian in the family you need to come here. Roasted beets, carrots, corn, whatever is in season. Then there are the meatetarians. They will be happy too because Roosters butchers their meat in house weekly. Basically, if I have a group of people with different tastes I need to please I come to Roosters. Everyone will be well fed at a reasonable price, and leave very happy.

Super cute restaurant! We ordered the hanger steak and it was so good! Would definitely order it again! Also ordered the pepperoni pizza. Very thin crust and super light. Really good pizza. Would definitely come here again.

Well this is my ALL TIME FAVORITE go to spot for a nice dinner with the hubster! The staff is great and the Food.....Um...the Food....my lord the Food...is incredible! I mean I could accidentally chew my own tongue when I devour, yes devour Lol, their Food! It's out of this world DELICIOUS! It's like an eye popping, jaw dropping, party in your mouth experience when you taste their food! Seasoned and cooked to perfection! My faves are their BBQ Chicken, Au Gratin Potatoes, Mac and Cheese, Fried Corn and Caesar Salad. I get this EVERY TIME I'm there! If it ain't broke, why fix it? Lol. Thanks Roosters for making my tastebuds dream of your food!
I really enjoyed eating here.  I was surprised at the food and service.  I will co0me back again if I am in the area.

I visited this restaurant just a few days ago to celebrate my birthday. I was in town from Winston Salem visiting friends and there were so many restaurant options to choose from. I decided upon Roosters after reading many positive Yelp reviews and they did not steer me wrong! The first thing you notice about Roosters upon walking in is the smell. OMG the food aroma was so enticing. I knew right away this was going to be a good experience. The restaurant was beautifully decorated and the music was awesome....a mix of older soul music. They had this really cool wall of Roosters to your left and the cooking area was right in the middle of the restaurant so you could see what was going on. We started with drinks. First, I ordered the pineapple crush (I think that's the name). I didn't like the drink but I heard it was pretty popular. The waiter immediately whisked it away and returned with my replacement, which was called Bourbon something or other... Sorry I forgot to write it down. But it was absolutely delicious. We started with an order of calamari for an appetizer and the free bread that came when we sat. It was super good and big enough for the three of us to share. Everything here is ala carte and the sides are big enough for two people to share. I ordered the scallops, my friend ordered the hangar steak and my son ordered the burger and fries. All three were extremely good! We also ordered three sides to share... The wilted spinach, mac and cheese and grilled corn. They were so good that I couldn't even pick a favorite!!! Finally, they offered me a complementary dessert since it was my birthday and I went with the coconut cake. It was almost like a coconut tres leche tower of yummy goodness. Moist and Rich and enough for the three of us to share. They even put a little candle on the top. The service here was top notch. Everything came out quickly and cooked to order. The waiter was on point and never let our drinks empty. Several others (possibly managers) even came around to ask if we were enjoying our meal and needed anything. If I lived in Charlotte, I would visit this place as much as possible. It's an upscale vibe but not one that you have to wear a shirt and tie to dine. I highly highly recommend this restaurant.

When I read the review that this Independent and non-franchised chef-owned place was in Charlotte - I went out of my way to eat here.  WOW!  WHAT A MEAL !

Let me say that again.. W O W !   Prices were fair, food superior quality and the hostess was delightful.  Delicious.  I can't wait to go back.

I really want to love this place, but now I've tried SP and Uptown and I just can't stand behind them. Since it's small plates (for not a small price) menu/a la carte model, I've tried quite a bit of things here ranging from daily specials to trusted/all the time items. I can't say I've really ever loved one thing very much. First red flag when going to a nice restaurant is when you can see a block of butter sitting on top of your sea food. It doesn't take a genius to realize butter makes everything taste good, so if you just drown your food in butter your guests are sure to love it. I realize that's common for veggies and for lower end restaurants, but I really expect more at an establishment that is bordering a nice dining experience. Their ambiance and decor is spot on, as it gives the illusion you're at a really fancy place, but the food is just not great. What happened to being inventive with flavor parings? Savory and sweet and getting creative? Literally 3/5 dishes I got were simply drowned in butter. The cauliflower special was decent, but it was literally charred cauliflower with loads of a Parmesan type cheese shredded over it. Second oldest trick in the book, douse your food in cheese and it magically tastes great. I could have gone to a Mexican restaurant if I was looking to get that. The best dish was the bok choy special, as it had sausage and another suspicious oil base it was submerged in, but I did actually like the sausage flavor (even it I doubt it even had 5 leaves of bok choy). I think if the price were much lower you'd understand what you were getting into, but overall I felt fat and stuffed after leaving, and didn't particularly love anything. The duck I had before was way too gamey, and they had no flavorful sauce to challenge the taste. Same with hangar steak this time, the sauce was literally worse that just eating the meat plain. Not sure if they do any marinating or dry rubs (highly doubt it since it literally tasted plain) but that would be a good thing for them to get into. I gave them 3 because they support farmers and have nice ambiance, but the food deserves a 2. The waitress had literally no personality and we might as well have had a robot wait on us. If that was the case, I'll bet the robot would have been more responsive and attentive. It took 2 of us (who actually were trying to hurry) over an hour for us to leave (clock starting after we were seated). It was very late on a Thursday and hardly anyone else there. I think waiting 15 minutes after bringing water to return may have been the first set back, but also only bringing beans for the first 20 minutes after ordering is what probably did us in. I any case, definitely recommend Bricktops which is right around the corner, and I've yet to have a bad meal in the 6x I've gone, and they are very similar in pricing. I think they pride themselves on cocktails and had a lot of wines, spend $90 this time without even trying any. Ouch.

This is a great Charlotte restaurant.  I have been a fan for a long time, but hadn't been there in about a year until yesterday when I stopped by for lunch.  Yep, still delicious!  

They always have a bunch of yummy in season vegetables on the menu.  The menu does not provide any descriptions, so you can be adventurous.   Or, don't be afraid to ask your server to explain a bunch of things to you.  I sure did when I couldn't decide between 5 items!

The dressing on my wedge salad was really salty, but I'm guessing that's not normal.  I was so hungry I didn't say a word and ate it anyways.  The mushroom pizza is amazing!

It has been a while since I've eaten here. When I did- boy was it good! This place is A la carte and a bit pricey (yet another "you get what you pay for" type of place). I ordered steak and onion rings - my buddy ordered duck with spinach. Everything came out so well prepared. You can tell they really put effort into presentation and quality. The steak had all the fat cut away - the meat was perfect and delicious, my buddy's spinach looked so good in the butter sauce - so bright green - at the time I didn't eat spinach but, it looked delicious! If you want to impress your date - this is a good place for that. It costs quite a bit but, the food is excellent.

I have 3 allergies which are typically not listed as ingredients on the menu. My waitress Elise was wonderful and informed, and helped me find items I could eat and would enjoy. I often experience a lot of difficulty with my allergies when dining out so this was a nice treat!

Uptown Location

This was another new restaurant in my Uptown Shuffle effort of trying to break old habits and eating at a wider variety of places while stuck Uptown.

The menu had many choices and I selected three offerings, the seared scallops, the assorted mushrooms, and the pan fried corn. Each and every dish was rich and flavorful and far exceeded my expectations.

The wait staff was attentive, my water glass was always full and I was consistently checked on to see if the meal was to my liking.

I left the restaurant full and satisfied with plans to return again. Next time I may try the bar which had several interesting chalkboard specials such as quail sausage,  venison bangers and mashed, and duck wings. Very Intriguing.

I have been here twice in the past year. The first time was ok. This time the service was poor and the food a little less on point.  My advice is to drive a couple more blocks to Bricktop and get better food and service. 

This time was during lunch with the place about 1/4 full (not very busy).  Table of four people. We were perfunctorily seated.  We waited 5 minutes for a server to come and fill the water glasses. He did say our waiter would arrive shortly. We waited another five minutes for him to show up.  Then he asked if we wanted anything else to drink. One member of the party asked to see the beer menu (more waiting).  Brought the beer menu and left. (More waiting)  Showed up later and took the drinks order. (Waited some more but not too long). Drinks arrived.  Waited some more and he brought the menus.  Waited some more and he took the appetizer order. Appetizers came out in a reasonable timeframe. Took our entree order but when one person wanted something he was told they were out of that and two other entree items (could of mentioned that when he gave the menus).  Food came out in a reasonable timeframe but the waiter did not clear the appetizer plates or the empty beer bottles on the table. (Which had been available for several minutes).  Just placed the entrees and left.  A few minutes later he came and cleared the appetizer plates but left the empty beer bottles!   Some food  was ok but one member of the party said his meal was really bad and left most of his food on the plate (he is a college student and tolerant of college fare so this says something). Entrée plates were cleared fairly promptly but the empty beer bottles remained on the table.  Water glasses were filled at good intervals. Check arrived at a reasonable timeframe. 

I seldom write poor reviews but this experience warranted it.  Due to the food quality, poor service and portion size for price. I recommend you not go here

Saturday night at 815 pm, party of 5. For those who have yet to try Roosters, their approach is a wide variety of small plates designed for sharing.  Everything is always prepared perfectly. This is a well run restaurant; caution you need a reservation unless you want to sit at a high top table in the bar area. This night we had several salads, Calamari (not as good as Wolfgang's). The flounder special was delicious, one of the best fish dishes we've had. Other entrees included the parpadelle with beef ragout, natural juice chicken, hanger steak and mac and cheese. Everyone loved their selections. Dessert was the currant bread pudding with vanilla gelato and a coconut cake. Everything was spot on. A $34 zin worked well with our choices.

Just had dinner here for the first time last week when I had family in town and must say this is a great option for groups as they have great quality food and lots of space.  Really enjoyed the elegant and welcoming atmosphere on the inside which boasted high vaulted ceilings, classic upscale decor, and huge comfortable booths if you're looking to a great setting to have dinner with a group of friends or family.  The interior really compliments and sets the table for the limited yet adequate dinner menu and family style sides.  Personally, I really liked the menu as it did not give me anxiety trying to decide on what to get.  They specialize in rotisserie chicken and a few other unique dishes, but everything we ordered was great.  By all accounts, the chicken was incredible and I ordered the duck for my entre and it was very, very good (although not the best I've ever had, I would still recommend to anyone who enjoys duck).  The sides are a la carte and done family style, so we shared the mashed potatoes and mac n cheese between 4 people.  The sides were superb and made to order.  They also had a great wine and drink menu which we shared a bottle or Cote du rhone ($36 not bad).  All and all it will not be the cheapest ($$ on Yelp should prob be $$+), you definitely get what you pay for here.  Will return!

Food:  9/10
Service:  10/10
Price:  7/10
ambiance:  9/10
value: 7.5/10

First off, I will say that the food here was VERY good! I went here with five other people last night and we were all really pleased with the appetizers and main dishes. We seriously got a ton of food: cheese, fried oysters, salads, two half chickens, gnocchi, steak burger, dessert, almost everything on the menu. Also can't forget about the wine, the list seems long, but there really isn't a ton a great wines on there. I wouldn't consider myself a wine snob (who would?), but I don't think I would come back for the wine (if you're into that). Food and wine aside, the service was also great. Our waiter was super friendly and seemed genuinely happy to be there.  Really the only thing I was disappointed with was where they sat us. We had a party of six, so they sat us in an atrium they share with their neighbors. It was quite. Too quiet. Eerily quite. They had no music playing so our conversation echoed quite a bit. I don't think this would be a problem if we were inside, but it did take away from our experience, slightly. 

All in all: I would totally go back just for the food. It was very tasty! :)

Roosters has so many great dishes to choose from.  Start with the appetizer of the charcuterie plate with the chicken liver mousse.    The only con would be that they never give enough bread for the meats and cheeses.  Ordered the beef short rib for dinner with sides of corn and mac and cheese.  If you only want one side, definitely order the corn.

Came here late on a Friday, and I was really impressed with the atmosphere.  The dining room was open, but wasn't as loud as some hardwood-high ceiling places can get.  There was a huge bar area, so I could definitely see myself coming back with a friend to split a few small plates and have a glass of wine at the bar late one weeknight.

I love small plates--I really enjoy being able to pick both a meat and a vegetable.  And, by pairing small dishes, my meal came out to be quite reasonable--I had the macaroni and green beans, and it ended up being under $15 before tax, tip, alcohol.  The green beans were wonderful - tender and perfectly cooked.  And it was a huge portion!  I definitely had leftovers, and two people could have easily split them (I guess that's why they're "sides").  The macaroni and cheese was really good too!  I love a well-made macaroni so I continually order it at restaurants, and end up disappointed most of the time because it lacks flavor.  I wasn't disappointed here!  The macaroni was rich, but not just creamy.

Everyone else I was with really enjoyed their food--most of us got a salad or vegetable and another of the small plates, and we found it the perfect amount of food.

Let me start by saying that I am a big fan of Jim Noble's, dating back to the original Noble's restaurant.  Also, this is my fourth time eating at Roosters, but my fist time eating lunch, and my first time back in several years.  Each time that I've eaten dinner at Roosters I've greatly enjoyed my food and experience....until now.  A group from work decided to grab lunch at the South Park location today.  While the menu options looked great, the food itself was not.  We started off with a few appetizers: calamari and fried livers.   The calamari also tasted undercooked as it was soggy and not very crispy.  The bigger issue was the livers, which were okay until I realized what I had just eaten was still uncooked with blood dripping from the center of the liver.  I let the server know and they removed this item from the bill.  I'm not sure what type of response I expected, I just thought that the reaction and response, or lack there of, wasn't adequate knowing that a customer had just ingested undercooked chicken.

For my meal, I asked the server for his recommendation.  He told us, "without a doubt" the prime rib sandwich is the way to go.  So, several of us ordered the prime rib sandwich, which was one of the specials.  To make a long story short, it was not good.  It wasn't terrible, just not what I would expect from a Jim Noble restaurant, or from a sandwich that cost over $15.  Also, the side Caesar salad was very mediocre.

All in all, I was very disappointed with Roosters.  Hopefully, I won't also end up with food poisoning to accompany the disappointment.

Have to agree with other reviewers.  I know some upscale restaurants have very small portions, but the food quality at roosters does not make up for the appetizer sized meals.  The server told us the sides were enough for 2-3 people to share and we did not find that to be true either.
Duck, shrimp,pizza and a pasta dish were  all ordered at our table.  All were reported to be ok or good, but nothing was earth shaking. 
Atmosphere was nice and service was great...but food not good enough to justify the prices.

Placed an order to-go at the bar and the service was great and quick. BBQ chicken was to die for and loved the spice rub on the wings. The sides we got were the corn and au gratin potatoes and they were amazing!! Definitely wouldn't plan to share the sides amongst more than 2-3 people though, portion sizes weren't that large.

Went here with my parents last evening to celebrate my mom's birthday. Since I was with my parents, dinner was on the early side at 4:00. We were greeted and immediately seated at a booth near the entrance. I was charmed by the rustic, industrial feel of the restaurant that included little doses of whimsy thanks to the frequent placing of roosters.

Our waiter came over to go over the menu. Roosters serves its sides a la carte, similar to a tapas style restaurant. They recommend getting an appetizer, a protein and sharing the sides.

My mom ordered the quarter natural chicken with fingerling potatoes, I ordered the smoked wings with pan fried corn, and my dad ordered the shrimp with fingerling potatoes. Unfortunately, this type of restaurant was out of the norm for my parents. When it comes to cuisine they are not adventurous at all. My mom liked her meal, she just wished that it came with more aus jus for her chicken. As for the shrimp my dad ordered, he received a plate of SIX, small shrimp that cost $17. SIX SHRIMP FOR SEVENTEEN DOLLARS. These weren't jumbo shrimp or anything like that. Just six, small grilled shrimp in a light sauce. All we could do was laugh because it looked ridiculous. I'm surprised the waiter was able to serve that with a straight face. A grown man served six shrimp. Just let that picture settle in for you. Thankfully, my order of smoked wings was a very hefty portion and I was able to share some with him. But seriously Rooster? take the shrimp off the menu. You're not doing anyone any favors with that option.

Honestly, if you come as duo, ordering the smoked wings is good bet because it's a bowl of at least 8-9 good-sized wings. The corn had a nice bite and flavor. The fingerling potatoes were OK, I would've preferred the yukon puree (aka mashed potatoes) but they weren't serving them at the time for some reason. As for the complimentary bread, it tasted stale and we were finally served it after sitting for a while.  The waiter seemed distracted even though it wasn't that busy.

Suffice it to say, my dad now has a good dining story to tell. Trust me, he's been telling EVERYONE he knows about how he was served a plate of six shrimp (for $17). Can't say that I'll personally be back as I wasn't blown away by the food and I don't like visiting a restaurant that's only serving certain things at certain times.

For lunch, tab for 3 without wine was $75. Quality of pizza has fallen ... oily, too much cheese, not enough mushrooms. Tomato bisque is as good as ever. Mac & cheese dry and salty -- avoid. Pan seared grouper was one dimensional, salt only with a tough and somewhat crispy skin. Bread basket contained cold sliced bread. Ordered salmon salad, waiter returned saying they were out but he could add a piece of warm salmon for $4. Huh? Jim Noble, come in and fix your restaurant.

We went to Roosters for brunch on a Sunday afternoon. It's very clean inside, and it smells deliciously of food cooking in the wood burning stove. My husband had the meatloaf with sweet potato purée and spinach. I had a chicken and cheese pizzetta, which is a fancy word for pizza. We enjoyed our food. My pizza was ordinary but good. Nothing extraordinary. My husband's meatloaf was very good, but the portion size is small for the money. Overall we enjoyed the experience there mostly for the nice environment and attentive waitstaff. We would return.

Some of my co-workers really like Roosters, so I've eaten there a few times. However, I'm always kind of disappointed.  As many people have mentioned, the serving sizes are minuscule.  Now, I am not saying that every restaurant needs to serve Applebee's-size trenchers of filler, but here you have to spend a lot of money to leave sans hunger.  In addition to this, the food is relatively so-and-so.  The last time I went for lunch, I ordered a roast turkey sandwich.  It was ok, except for the fact that the bacon was burned.  You'll find a lot of little careless errors like that.

Additionally, the dining room is so cavernous that you cannot hear your dining companions, and, perhaps even more frustratingly, the servers cannot hear you.  They really need to put up some acoustic paneling or something.  

Rooster's... meh.  There's potential, but it's just that--still potential.

Very amazing food but a little pricey. Everything is  A la Cart so the tab added up quick for a steak and chicken with 3 sides to share with an app. We spent $100.00 that's including tip. 
I like Kings kitchen over Roosters (Same owner) little less expensive, still amazing food and doesn't feel as fancy which I like. 
Still a great place and I would go again! :)

Oh and the rotisserie chicken with BBQ is amazing.

This place has really perfected southern meets European cuisine.   The staff is awesome,  and the food is well done.   Great short ribs and salmon.   The sides are next level. Pureed sweet potatoes are buttery smooth.   I loved the hoppin, John and beets.   A must visit dining experience.

Decided to eat here based on other Yelp reviews.

They were not wrong! This a a great place.

And, as others have noted, very slightly overpriced (all dishes are a la carte, sides are $5-$7).

Also, note to Northerners: I ordered BBQ chicken. I should have expected it but was slightly surprised by the Carolina style, vinegar based BBQ sauce. Once again, it was VERY good, but just don't think that it's like the typical St. Louis/Texas tomato based sauces.

Also, server was very attentive and the atmosphere is very cool. They have an extensive seating area/bar around the open kitchen ... which I should have sat at as it's WAY more entertaining!

It was fun trying a lot of different things, but of course at a cost since it's à la carte. It was good; not great. My favorite part was my arugula, almond & goat cheese salad. My husband liked his goat cheese platter. My wings were way too salty and dry. I liked my polenta and the corn was good, too.

First time visit; will return!

I had never been to Rooster's before but was thoroughly impressed. I took advantage of making a reservation online and called the same afternoon to confirm. When we arrived, the door was opened for us, and the hostess had casual conversation with us and made us priority even though it was fairly busy. 

As soon as we were seated, our waitress Leah greeted us and welcomed us to the establishment. She quickly took our drink order and returned to go over the menu with us. She gave excellent dish recommendations and told us how their food is gathered from local vendors and how it is prepared. 

The food was amazing. Large, flavorful portions consumed the plates; not once did I think I didn't get enough food. We didn't opt for dessert but they had many options along with coffee drinks too.

The only complaint I have is that it was rather loud. For being an upscale restaurant, with prices being what they are, it was a bit annoying having to almost yell across a small table to communicate with the person I was with. 

With the experience I had at Rooster's, I will be returning in the future.
My favorite place to enjoy dinner and drinks when I'm in Charlotte. The salmon is perfect and the chocolate mousse cake is the perfect ending to a great meal.

So this was another one of those places.  The kind of place which was talked up like crazy.  We went here one Friday for lunch this past summer, and I can honestly say I was disappointed.  I was told how good their burgers are and how 'kewl' the place was, etc... blah blah the usual...

We arrived around 11:20am --I know that's early, but I start to eat my desk if I get past 11:45am.  We were seated instantly and our drink order was taken relatively quickly.  About 15 minutes later, at about 11:40am, our drinks were brought to the table.  As you can imagine, I'm starting to think about chomping on the table at this point!  Soon as our waitress passed out the drinks --that she clearly ran out to bottle herself at the local Coca Cola bottling facility, she took our order.  Then we waited...  And waited.  And waited.

Finally, the order was brought to the table at around 12:35pm.  I received a side salad, which was simply just a side salad and nothing more --I 'think' it may have had a tomato on it --bonus, and this smallish burger sitting in the middle of a plate the size of a small platter --interesting, I thought.  I figured based on this plain, weak presentation, this thing was going to taste like fillet on a bun!  I couldn't have been more wrong.  It tasted nothing more than 90/10 ground beef cooked on my grill at home one night after work, without seasoning--very disappointing.

To add to the fun, they actually screwed up my coworkers lunch, resulting in him having to wait another 10-15 minutes for the reorder.  Aside from the fun activities of the time it took to get the order, the restaurant itself was literally 55°; it was freezing in there.  Perhaps that was because I had no food inside me to keep me warm?

For the food you got and its taste, I felt was overpriced --maybe they just have to charge a lot to keep the AC units running with such ferocity...

Decided to come here with my wife after reading the reviews. We came in one night and waited to be seated. Placed seemed a little busy. After about five minutes we were sat and waited for someone to take our order. We waited about 10 minutes and watched as staff came and went. Not one person said hello or we'll be with you shortly. That from a customer service perspective is unacceptable. We got up and left. Unable to review the food since no one helped us. I'll leave you to decide the service rating.

Just got back from a fabulous dinner at Roosters. My friend and I were seated quickly and begun to peruse their wine by the glass menu. Minus 1/2 star; I had higher expectations for the wines by the glass. Its like they tried to hard to be diverse and missed a little. Other then that the items on the menu were great. 

We ordered the Onion Soup, the arugula salad, the brussel spouts, hanger steak, and the pumpkin gnocchi. My favorite was the gnocchi. It was perfectly cooked light and delicate. Those 5 items plus two $9 glasses of wine ended up being a bit over $40 each including tip. Definitely worth it. Food was done in what I like to call " gormetey" as in; every dish tasted unique and different. The only thing that I didn't look, ie: the other minus 1/2 a star is because the onion soup was a bit salty. It was amazing just a bit more salt then I would prefer. 

I would definitely recommend this place and its the type of place I would take my boyfriend or out of town visitors. Give it a try!

Rooster's food is average. I've been a couple of times and both experiences were unremarkable. I don't generally bother writing restaurant reviews, but upon recently learning that Jim Noble--the owner of Rooster's--actively supports the far-right, discriminatory group Alliance Defending Freedom, I felt I couldn't remain silent. Guess what? You have the freedom to spend your money at any variety of restaurants in Charlotte that have better food and are owned by decent humans who operate their businesses ethically. If you care about not supporting a bigot, then there are plenty of other wonderful restaurants to patronize. I'll never set foot in another Jim Noble establishment* again.  

* King's Kitchen, Rooster's, and the soon to open Noble Smoke

This was our 2nd visit, but its been a few years since the first..(1st visit was perfect 5*.......Great atmosphere, great service, awesome food, fair prices,, be sure to check out the brunch menu!.....

My husband and I have eaten here twice for dinner and both times we were very pleased with our meals as well as the service.  Roosters can either be a $40 dinner or a $100 all-out eating fest.  We have tried both approaches.  

The first night we ate there for Valentine's Day - we shared a 1/2 carafe of wine, we each had a salad, and I ordered the hangar steak (delicious!) and my husband ate seafood off the specials menu.  Both of us were incredibly happy with our meals.  We shared some beets as a side dish - very tasty!  That evening a special dessert was also offered - an apple tart that required about a 20 minute preparation so I ordered that when my dinner arrived.  The tart was incredible.  My husband ordered the coconut cake and, unfortunately, it was still partially frozen when it arrived at the table.  

Tonight we ate at the bar.  Very cordial server, bartender, hostess, busgirl ... everyone was very friendly.  We did not have a reservation so we opted to sit at one of the community tables near the bar.  My husband and I shared a plate of zucchini fries with a lemon aioli.  The zucchini fries were pretty good but the lemon aioli was amazing!  My husband ordered the hangar steak tonight and I ordered the smoked wings.  We shared a plate of brussels sprouts as our side.  I am an enormous wing fan and these were fabulous.  They were hot in a peppery hot sort of way.  The plate of wings was huge but I somehow managed to finish them with only a little help from my husband.  I cannot wait to order these again!  No dessert for us tonight and no drinks so our bill was just over $40.  Delicious.

Place was very crowded sat at bar I know bar stools 
that have no back allows for more chairs but it is very uncomfortable 
Was cold today had on a jacket and not great eating 
with a jacket on
Ken the bartender was excellent today he needed running shoes made lot trips from behind the bar
Food and service was very good 
Will go back
All servers and bartender seem to have a very good working relationship

High end Southern cuisine. The interior has a feeling of modern barn chic. The wait staff all wore thick aprons, attentive and knowledgeable about their food. I was with two other coworkers, so we were able to sample a variety of dishes. Many are large enough to share, but its almost tapas in style so each person could order 2. The duck wings were double fried, served in a thick, rich, and a (little too) sweet sauce, tossed with sesame seeds. Definitely had an Asian flavor. The cauliflower was charred and nutty, the yellow/green olive oil adding a great vegetative flavor. Mussels were served in a delicious broth, I used the crusty bread and a spoon to sop up every bite. The succotash was buttery with sweet corn and beans. Cocktails have some amazing combinations of interesting liquors that I even had to ask what they were.

Review just for the bar!

Went here last night for after dinner drinks and I will definitely have to come back for dinner. 

Everyone was very friendly here, the atmosphere was comfortable and intimate, and decor is Euro Country with a wall of stuffed roosters (which may have freaked me out if I had noticed it before leaving).

Our bartender was a funny, funny man who makes a killer gimlet. They have a wide selection of wine and alcohol. And a great seating area in front of the bar. 

Watching the chefs in the open kitchen made me drool a little bit. I'm eating there soon. Who wants to join??

So upon the request from people who insisted I try this place.. I have, finally!

Venue - I saw the establishment first from inside the plaza like indoors - and thought it looked a bit.. old.  But yesterday, I had came in from the front and was relieved and surprised to see such a nice set up.  Okay, the roosters on the left side of the wall is a bit much.  I will not let that deter me from what else is to come. 

Service - Good.  I had a waitress who took care of my friends and I. 

Food - As others have mentioned, not ground breaking.  I was anxious about what I should order. The obvious being, chicken!  But I just did not feel for chicken last night. So I had help from Yelp's tips and reviews and I have ordered:

- Mac n' Cheese: Good, hot and piping good.  Cheesy and delicious.

What I ordered on my own
- Fried Oyster: It was okay.  I asked for an honest opinion that it is to die for, but.. it was mediocre.
- Lobster Bisque: It was good. Not bad

Price - It was a little pricey, hence I avoided the Scallop entrée (which I normally ALWAYS get). I just cannot bring myself to pay $19 + sides.. just.. not worth it to me. And the Yelpers helped steered me away from it. 

I left feeling content.  Would I come back, meh.  If my friends wanted me to come meet them up, I would.

I was a little disappointed. Duck confit was highly recommended but wasn't very well browned outside of a single spot where it touched a pan. I've usually had it browned/crispy everywhere. BBQ chicken was very fatty. 

The succotash was great.

Probably won't come here again but I might go try the burger. Too expensive for what we got.

The food was absolutely delicious. I had the anger stage which was cooked to perfection. I also had the roasted fingerling potatoes and the gratin potatoes, butter beans, pizza, onion rings, the friends that came to help celebrate my birthday their dishes were out of this world delicious! Our waiter named Joseph was very attentive and offered great feedback on what drinks to try and make sure that we had everything we needed. 
I plan to go again and again! My new fav local spot!! 
#woot#woot

Awful waitress was not attentive left us sitting 15minutes however very attentive 2 the table across from mine and their 2 oversize dogs. It was clear that we were racially profiled.  It seems the south has yet 2 accept they lost 2 the Yankees. They received 1 star only because I would not have been able 1 post w/o it

My husband and I were greeted by the hostess very nicely and shown right to our table. Our first time to dine here & will be on our list of favorites for sure! 
    Our waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu, and offered ideas re: sides etc.
   Our only complaint was our waitress was very rushed and would often sprint away before we could ask a question or  make a request. She almost seemed out of breath. She also spoke very fast & we needed to have her repeat herself.  Very noisy atmosphere, yet we really enjoyed the fun decor.
    The menu was exceptional, Many interesting choices!  The specials sounded delicious. Great wine selection.  Our salads and entrees were wonderful, perfectly seasoned and prepared. As foodies, we are happy to say, Rooster's does not disappoint! We WILL return!

I've been to the Uptown location and loved it, so I decided to visit this location as well. The quality at this location was great as well. I went with the BBQ Chicken and mac and cheese. The BBQ Chicken was cooked perfectly and the sauce had great flavor. The mac and cheese is also very cheesy and delicious as well. Our server was great and made great recommendations for our party. Typically chicken is fairly safe and similar at most restaurants, but I'd definitely put Rooster's a step above.

I have been to Roosters countless times. It is one of my favorite restaurants. I typically start with the onion soup or lettuce wedge with blue cheese. Try the open faced meatloaf with shiitake cream. The wine prices are more than reasonable. The coconut cake is great. The chocolate pate with pistachio ice cream and pecan praline is even better. Not sure how that is possible. Both desserts are out of this world.

My daughter really wanted Mac and Cheese. At first we were a little intimidated, this place looked a bit more than casual dining.  However, the wait staff was very pleasant, I couldn't get my drink below half way if I tried (and I tried!)  The food was perfectly portioned, all be it a bit expensive, but the atmosphere, food quality, and service is where the price comes in.  My daughter ordered a side of ketchup to mix into her Mac and Cheese (after much debate), it was met with a quick turnaround and the hostess came over and set her at ease, suggesting next time she should try and mix the tomato soup with the Mac and Cheese. Lastly, the lunch menu had just enough selection so we weren't overwhelmed. We will definitely come back with family for special occasions, or just for the Mac and Cheese service!

Nice ambience, our server was awesome I forgot her name unfortunately. 

I made reservations for five and my Dad checked in first. The hostess seats us at a table for four, not five. She was real short about it, I understand that it was a busy night but I still had to wait 20-30 more minutes than my reservation time. I honestly don't think she thought my friend was part of our party, because she was not Caucasian or Asian. Just being honest. Dinner was cold and the potato side was raw. Spent $300.00+ for dinner. Maybe the one in uptown is better.

Food was great! Service was okay, it was a busy Friday night though.  Really thought the sides were the best parts of our meal. This isn't taking anything away from the mains, Pork Chop (me) & Flounder (wife), as those were awesome as well but the sides were awesome-er! Wish they had more local specialty craft beers on-tap, but other than that, four thumbs up and a food coma for us! We will be returning for sure...

My husband and I had lunch here just the other day and dinner some time ago.  We enjoyed both visits, although I have to say I enjoyed the dinner menu more.  This time around I ordered the roast chicken wrap.  I was planning on ordering something different, but once the server explained to my husband what was on it, I decided to order it too.  Put pickled red onions on anything and I'm in!  The wrap was good, but close to being over-seasoned.  It comes with a side of fries, but you can get a different side for $1 more so I ordered the onion rings.  I'm glad I did - they were great.  Cut thin, almost like onion straws...quite addictive.  

Service was excellent and the food came out FAST.  Almost too fast! I wish the server knew a little more about the craft beer selection.  When asked what the Highland Seasonal was, she responded that she wasn't sure but she knew it was good because the brewery planned to start making it available year-round.  Rather than wait for her to check into it, I simply ordered something else.  No biggie.

I love the atmosphere of this restaurant - laid back and cozy.  I'm looking forward to going back again soon!

I had lunch today; the special salmon cakes on succatash.   It was excellent.  I'm not surprised to learn from the server that they usually run out of it.  The service, selection, ambiance is excellent,  parking in adjacent lot.  Highly recommend.

Unique restaurant with good service and good food. A few items I want to mention were exceptional. The chicken wings. The Best....   The martini with blue cheese stuffed olives. Yummy if I could handle a lot of booze I would have had way more than just one. The coconut cake was very good. The augraten potatoes were very good. The place was really neat. Two large bars, at least four dining area, great atmosphere. Will be back next week after I get my knee injection at Flexogenix clinic down the street.

The restaurant is pretty big and is really nice inside though the exterior is pretty cookie cutter in a strip mall.  The food is served a la carte and we were told by our server that everything from dressings to breadcrumbs is made from scratch in-house. They are a farm to fork concept, with most of it being local. The portions vary so if you're very hungry ask whether a side is necessary.  

I had pork spare ribs, slaw, frites the ribs had a great flavor I have no idea what kind of vinegar they were done in but it was very unique! I loved it but I must say the ribs themselves seemed very fatty and not an amazing quality but they were made to perfection!  The fries some yelpers bragged about were just ok nothing special but not bad.  My brother ordered the spice rubbed & smoked wings.  Talk about flavor wow they were smoked to perfection I ate two of them before my brother was ready to stab me with a fork!  The only problem is its 12 bucks for an order of either 10-12 not sure so very pricey!  So all in all a good visit is remember you are paying high dollar for your meal.

For desert we ordered the coconut cake and the & caramel cake w/caramel sauce, praline gelato,  both were really good above average quality and taste. I would say all in all this place is worth your time to give a try I really liked everything about it even if it a little price especially since the ribs had a flavor unlike any i have ever had!

Not really great. Service was very slow even though the restaurant was not busy. We ordered the chicken fingers for the kids and there were 4 pieces of the size of chicken nuggets at Chick-fil-a. They have brought more in and did not charge us, but this was very strange. I ordered the roasted chicken pizza and it was an appetizer size, I would have eaten something else if I knew it. The pizza tasted okay, could taste the garlic only nothing else. Restaurants keep adding garlic to tomato sauces and this is wrong, should be stopped. Tomato sauce does not have garlic, not sure who taught that to the american chefs. The fries that came with my wife's burger were great and she said the burger was average but nothing memorable. Will probably go back, but without high expectations.

Whether you are uptown or out here in South Park area Roosters is a solid choice for either dinner or lunch.  I've been to this one a few times and at my latest visit I tried the fried oyster salad.  So perfect, the coolness of the greens combined with the warm fried oysters was just a perfect combo.  

The service here was great but the seating was a bit awkward where my girlfriend and I sat.  I have to mention it because it was really noticeable.  The table was a solid six inches away from both of us so it made for a weird eating arrangement to say the least.  

I wouldn't let that deter you from eating here at all though.  Just get a better seat :)

Independent and non-franchised chef-owned restaurants are like snowflakes, each one a little different.  Some you adore, some just aren't so appealing.  Certainly Rooster's and it's high-profile chef (for Charlotte) fit into that category.  Having now visited here a healthy handful of times, I can say if you are the type of person who looks at dining out as more of an experience than an occasion to stuff your gullet, Rooster's will appeal.

First, the ambiance:  Spacious room with an open kitchen right in the center, where the wood-fired grill is always visible.  Like a buzzing beehive, the chefs busily push each other on while servers quickly pick up plates and make deliveries to the surrounding booths and high-topped tables.  The decoration is best described as rustic European-country farm.  A wall of wine compartmentalized into bins contrasts with stuffed fowl on the opposing wall.  Dark woods and dim lighting make for a most intimate and romantic feel, though it can get a little loud due to the high ceilings at peak times.

Cuisine is primarily European-inspired with an emphasis on local-sourcing.  But the Southern influence is noticeable throughout, especially in the veggie offerings and vinegar-based barbecue sauce.  Like a finer European restaurant, the concept is smaller dishes, with a big emphasis on flavor, texture, and/or presentation. Again, the idea is dining as a full sensory experience.  Fries cooked in truffle oil, buttered butter beans, house-made gnocchi.  Even the cheese and charcuterie boards have some interesting picks. Surprise find for me- chicken liver mousse.  I'm not a liver eater, by any means, but I'd put this smooth operator on crunchy toast any day of the week.

All this said, I don't find Rooster's pretentious at all: servers are happy to take time with you and will gladly take back anything that does not appeal and offer a substitution.  The menu also includes a full range of staples for the not so adventurous. 
 
Wine is almost a must here due to the voluminous wine offerings and the captain's list.  Broad enough to appeal to just about any palette and price point, the selections are well known by the educated severs who can help you pick.  They will also let you sample any wine sold by the glass before pouring a regular serving.  A small selection of microbrews and a full bar complete the drink offerings.

Bottom line: If you are into large portions, and favor quantity for your buck, you will leave here disappointed.  If, though, you look to quality and overall experience, I find Rooster's has it in spades.

Not impressed. One bathroom for women and men with one stall in busy large restaurant. Vegetables poorly seasoned/bland and not special to warrant a la carte pricing. The meat course is the only thing I felt was quality checked and seasoned well. Cosmo coctail was poorly made which is why I switched to wine. Small wine list. Service was fantastic and the atmosphere was enjoyable however I just wouldn't come back here again based on my poor food experience and high price tag. There are other quality restaurants I'd spend 30% less, not have to wait to share a bathroom, and have more quality seasoned food in this area.
Rotisserie chicken was insanely good!   Cool atmosphere, MAC and cheese was stellar, and different.  Anxious to come back and try other things.

Located across the street from South Park mall. I came on a weekday for lunch. Server was attentive and nice. It has decor to support the name. There are all kinds of roosters on the wall. I really enjoyed my wine and my friend loved the beer. Portions are great if your trying to loose weight or not hungry.  The food was okay. They have several eclectic dishes. The corn was bland and cold despite it being in a skillet. The strips that came in a sauce was okay, but lacked flavor. I had the shrimp salad and I wish the shrimp was warm and seasoned, but it was plain, cold, and lacked flavor or seasoning.  They just tossed it on there. Management came by to check on the table and seemed to help staff that was nice. Over I am not sure what the hype is about this place on a weekday mid afternoon this place was packed. I am wondering if I ordered the wrong dishes or if they had new persons in the back making the food. The best part about this place is the service, however the menu and food served needs to be re-examined.

So glad our original plans to dine at the Cowfish fell through... first off, we are new to the South Charlotte area, (relocated from West Coast) and have found most restaurants to be sub par at best... due to a reservation mix up at the Cowfish, our party of 6 was left to figure out an alternative dining solution.   Did a quick google search for nearby restaurants and Roosters popped up, soooooo glad it did!!! I called the restaurant, not confident that they would be able to accommodate a party of our size last minute (and on a weekend!) but the hostess assured me that she was going to PERSONALLY put our table together and that when we arrive we would be seated immediately- I thought "Yeah right"... boy I ate those mental remarks by the pound..  it was as she said, beautifully arranged and readily available for us to be seated.  The whole staff was friendly and hospitable, I mean the WHOLE staff was!  A pleasant change from what we've encountered from similar dining establishments in the South end.. but the "icing on the cake" was our server, Tommy.  He went above and beyond to ensure that our experience was nothing less than phenomenal and he exceeded every expectation from potentially at times, fussy customers?.  The food and the Wine list (our teenager called it the wine glossary lol) only magnified the experience... beautifully cooked med rare burger and hangar steak, to the delectable sides and the amazing desserts... I'm afraid that Rooster's has raised the bar for its nearby competitors, to them I say good luck .. Tommy and Roosters have earned our future business - we have become quite spoiled at Roosters and will make sure that all our friends and family come to dine here!!! Thanks so much for the wonderful experience

How does this restaurant have so few raving reviews on Yelp? Either the folks in Charlotte don't know a great restaurant when they see it, or it's just a little too southern for the New Yorkers in Charlotte. The food was exceptional, the service was friendly and knowledgeable, and the hosts were incredibly nice. I enjoyed sitting at the stools by the open kitchen, and everything that emerged from the kitchen looked so inviting. I had the roasted duck wings with delicious chili aioli, and the quarter barbq chicken. The chicken was tender and moist, and I enjoyed the sauce. I felt that the chicken could have been even better had it been smoked. The fried corn was excellent as an accompaniment. There were so many things I wanted to try on the menu, and I think I shall go back for the succulent looking grilled burger. I loved it!

Delicious food and good service! I had the hanger steak and it was very good. They have a great selection of smoked meats, pizzas, pastas, etc... The only thing I found a little annoying was the a la carte sides. $10 for a side of asparagus is a bit excessive however, it is definitely worth checking out if you are in the Charlotte area!

We love their Natural Chicken (ask for extra Au Jus!!), their Succotash, and their Brussel Sprouts are the BEST in town (if only they'd feature them more often). Someone there said they were "seasonal", but we've had year round Brussel Sprouts at other restaurants here year round :-(

Great food and great service.  I had the grilled salmon and it was cooked perfectly.  We ordered enough sides for the entire table to share and my favorite were the potatoes, that could have been my entire meal and I would have been happy. 

I liked that they had local craft beer on the menu although the two best were missing: NoDa and Old Meck.

The atmosphere is great. It's very open, somewhat loud but not enough that you can't enjoy your conversation. 

Can't wait to go back!

Rooster's is great, with a few nits I wish they would work on.  

The place smells incredible, thanks to the wood-fired grill.  You may smell like you've been sitting around a fire when you leave, but it's a small trade off for great food.  The decor is a bit alarming - And I don't mean to scare you, but there are roosters on the wall.  Try not to upset them....

I've eaten quite a few things off the menu and in generally, it's all really good.  The best tip I can provide is try the specials.  They are generally seasonal and local foods.   I have never been disappointed when order the specials.  Also - the vegetable they offer are just great too.  I'm typically a meat eater, but I enjoy getting a bunch of vegetables to try different things.

My two nits about my numerous experience there:

1) I've only ordered red wine there, and every time I find the wine is served around room temperature.  I know this sounds super pretentious, but I prefer my red wine chilled a bit.  Room temperature is just a bit too warm.  
2) For as wide of menu as Rooster's offers, the drink menu is extremely light.  I would encourage them to develop some cool seasonal cocktails.  This was one missing piece to the experience....

Absolutely head to Rooster's for a great meal - One of the best in Charlotte.

I was pleasantly surprised at how great the food was. We are from out of town and had never eaten there. We ate tapas style (highly recommend the cauliflower, Brussels sprouts and shrimp) everything was so good and I enjoyed every bite. Our waitress was great. She was very helpful and friendly. She was even great at recommending wine!

Somehow walked in and sat at the bar during a busy Saturday night!!

Lots of great cocktails---solid wine list and tons of people!

Loved the open kitchen and the quality of usual dishes.  We started with Fried Watermelon---pretty different and good. 

The brick-oven pizza was very good with fresh cheese, meats, and vegetable toppings.  However, the whole meal was tied together by a yummy Chateauneuf-Du-Pape by the glass!!!

Good experience--good food.

It's easy to overlook Rooster's SouthPark location, in a bland retail center across from the mall. But overlook it you must, because just inside the unimpressive facade waits one of Charlotte's best dining experiences.

From the delicious calamari to the signature roasted chicken and beef short rib, everything about our meal was outstanding. But the best part may have been the check -- with perfectly portioned entrees at reasonable prices, Rooster's may be one of the Queen City's best values in upscale dining. So don't let the sparse location deter you -- this is well worth the visit.

My friends raved about this place!

An a la carte establishment that had great food at reasonable prices. I actually think a la carte pricing can work if the entree portions are big enough to make them a meal in and of themselves, which Roosters does.

There wine selection is good and the wait staff is very helpful in pairing one of their many wines with dishes you plan to order.

I had the chopped salad and was told the butter beans were to die for....well, I don't think dead came to mind when i ate them, but they were pretty good.

I ordered the hanger steak which was cooked perfectly to medium rare and tender!  Lordy...lordy!

It is a large space, but the bar had community seating which I love because for two reasons....first, it allows you to "spice it up" as you'll never know who might sit beside you...and second, many places in NYC have this type of seating.

If you ever find yourself in the South....check this place out!

I gave it four stars because it was a bit overpriced and service was slow although, the food quality was very good. 
 
     The reason I thought it was overpriced was because for a side bowl of asparagus it costed $10 and the other $6-$8 sides were small for their pricing. The only other reason it too pricy was because the cornish hen was $24. 

     I thought the food was great. I got the cornish hen. It was prepared in three different ways: flash fried, seared, and baked (as the waitress informed us)! It was also served with carrots, carrot purée, and as well as purple potatoes. 

     Overall the food was great, and although it was a bit pricy, it was worth the cost.

I love this restaurant, both locations. Their PEI muscles and their charcuterie are my favorites. I like the fact that everything is fresh and prepared from quality ingredients. I also love the way the owners give back to the community. Def go here to eat! You'll love it.

I was looking forward to my dining experience at Roosters but was greatly disappointed. 

Though I had a reservation, I had to wait 15 minutes for my table. The bar was full and it was raining so I was forced to stand in the doorway as they have no designated waiting area. The atmosphere was far too noisy to hold a conversation. The waitress did her best sales job and told me about the beautiful scallops that looked like "toasted marshmallows" when they came from the oven. She didn't tell me that they were miniature marshmallows, three of them to be exact. For $18.00 I got three scallops with no sides. The best part about the meal was the steamed green beans ($5 extra) and the bottle of wine. Hard to mess those up. 

I came home, made a sandwich and crossed Roosters off of my places to eat in Charlotte.
I went here on a business trip.  My salad was great but the short rib was dry.  The rib needed to be seated more so it could be juicer.

A quick dinner meeting led us here tonight. I started with the arugula salad, followed by the roasted chicken pizza and finished off with tomato bisque soup. All were delicious!! Really cool atmosphere and great service!

I heard that this was one of the new trendy places in Charlotte but it is highly over rated.  The prices are high considering the quality and the portion size of the food.  The 1/2 chicken is $13.00 and does not come with anything.  The taste was bland to say the least.  The roasted take-out chickens from Wal-Mart are more appetizing and the mashed potatoes from Bo-Jangles are better too.   It is not child friendly either since there is no menu for them which is a little unusual considering it is a casual restaurant and the family demographics of Charlotte.  I ordered chicken fingers for my daughter for $5-$6 and then added an order of fried for $5.  Horrible value.  The service was disappointing too.  We arrived well before the Saturday night rush and had a reservation and asked to be seated in a booth since there were two open booths.  The hostess said that we needed to request a booth when we called and that it was reserved for someone else.  I have never heard of such a thing for a casual restaurant.   I know that the chef has done well but I would not recommend Roosters to anyone.  There are many better choices  in Charlotte for far-less money and better quality.  I would not even call it a Tapas style restaurant either.

I have dined here 3 times and I just don't think this is worth the price. Everything is a la carte here and the portion sizes are NOT GOOD IMHO. On our last outing we ordered a salad that our waitress said was big enough to share. WRONG! When she brought it out on two plates, the portions were so puny, there was no way that was sufficient for two to share. We like the bbq chicken and the wings which have always been good but the sides are skimpy. We like the panfried corn but it is  $7 as a side and it was  SMALL portion. To be truly satisfying for two you would need two orders and I can't see paying $14 for some corn! I appreciate the whole farm to table philosophy of the restaurant but people also like to think that they are getting good value as well. I never feel that way when I leave this restaurant. 

A previous reviewer stated you should bypass Roosters and go down the street to Bricktop and I would have to agree with that sentiment.
Great service and food.  Sean did a great job as our server, and he engaged memorably with our children to make it a special evening.

Rooster's is a tough place to describe, if only because it offers so much. They sell themselves as a Tapas type place, but I think that's a tough description. 

We went there a little while ago for no real reason--we hadn't heard too much about it or anything, but it seemed appealing and new. Again, it's hard to pin down what they're serving up, except to say that it was all pretty good. The place itself is really nice--very large and wide open, with modern tables and such. I like this kinda place--doesn't seem chain-y or anything. 

As for the food, it was good, not transcendent. Lots of small plates and options like that. I actually enjoyed the pizza the most, although it was all pretty decent. At our table of three, I think 3 or 4 national cuisines were sampled, if that makes sense. 

Great wine list, too.

Solid spot with solid food and drink offerings. We always forget about Rooster's when we're racking our brains for dinner spots. On the occasion that we remember them, we're never disappointed. We've sat in their dinning room for a special occasion (happy birthday to meeeeeeee, I'll have the scallops!) but more often than not land at the bar. It's more laid back and there's almost never a wait. 

Any meat or seafood dish is going to be a win at Rooster's. We love the BBQ chicken and scallops. On our most recent visit, I had a daily special -- lamb bolognese gnocchi. It wasn't as good as Bruce Moffet's gnocchi but it wasn't bad either. 

We even love grabbing a couple beers and a charcuterie board. Depending on which 5 meats and cheeses you select, price ranges from @ $22-$28. A steal when most of the meats and cheeses on their own will run you $8-$10.

Wife and I had Dinner here. Suggested you make a reservation, which we didn't and waited a while for a table. For an appetizer we ordered the Pork Belly, and Fried Oysters(both excellent), entree was Half Free Range chicken that can be ordered Natural, or BBQ. Duck Breast, and Spinach. The food arrived at an excellent temperature. Our server Lauren was great, and was very gracious in enduring my jokes. By the way on a side note it was raining extremely heavy and we had walked from the hotel. Gracious lady who was waiting for her husband offered a ride back to our hotel. Great people! If you're in the area you need to eat at this excellent establishment.

Slow service! Food okay. Wait staff didn't say anything about sides, so if you order the chicken that all you get.. Sorry service! Plus it took an hour to get our food and waited for our drinks! Now it's time to stop somewhere else to get some food!

I love Roosters - both locations. I've never had a bad experience at either location.  The Southpark location is so cozy. The hostess opened the doors when we arrived. We were seated immediately on a Saturday night.

The food is so good! Our table ordered the fried oysters, pizza, bbq chicken, mac & cheese, and the brisket burger. #noregrets

We were not disappointed in our choices. I'd recommend anything on their menu. 

The whole menu is ala carte & they recommend that you order your own entree and share the sides.  Try this place out. You won't regret it!

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte.  I always end up eating here at least once when I am in town.

This visit again did not disappoint.

Went with a coworker for a later dinner.  I ordered the mussels, arugula salad with fresh peaches, and the shishito peppers.  Unfortunately since we were there a bit late they were out of the peppers ordered the heirloom tomatoes with micro basil instead.  

My coworker ordered the quarter natural chicken, au gratin potatoes(which are to die for), and the roasted red kuri squash.  Again because we were there later, they were out of the au gratin potatoes, she ordered the Mac and cheese instead.

Everything was amazing.  I love the fact that they use local ingredients. The food is fresh and has so much flavor.  The presentation is wonderful.  

Some reviewers feel that this place is a little expensive.  I think you get what you pay for and this is definitely worth it.  A true dining experience.

I will definitely be back when I am in town.
This is my favorite restaurant, honestly. It has it all. Great, warm ambiance, fantastic service, and always consistently amazing food. Go here, you won't be disappointed.

This place missed the mark on so many levels for us. 

I'll start with the service, since this was the only great part of the experience. Our waiter was very friendly and spent time with us going over the menu. He was attentive, brought us everything we asked for and offered to replace my soup when I didn't like it. He gets the 1 star I gave here. 

Here's my list of the bad:
- What the hell is that wall of dead birds? 
- The wood fired beets - tasted more like rubber lumps, no wood fired taste. 
- The pan fried corn - yes, it's pan fried corn, my bad for expecting some spices in there. 
- The onion soup - overly salty and has a strong, unidentifiable flavor. 
- The scallops - nothing special at all.
- The prices - for what we paid, I would expect to be spoon fed while being fanned with palm leaves. Really a said combo of inflated prices and mediocre food you could prepare at home for nothing.

And be forewarned: Everything is a la carte. Ordering scallops? That's $20, and then you may add a side for $7. What a joke. 

Bring a fat wallet  of money you were thinking of setting on fire and low expectations and you should leave happy.

The food was pretty good. I had the spare rib which was really good but the eggplant was over seasoned. Salad was good and server was accommodating when we saw him. I was really disappointed in the service. Restaurant was not crowded but our server was MIA for a really long time. We finally asked one of the back staff to refill our drinks and ordered another beer from someone who walked by.
I could probably overlook everything about this restaurant that night except the fact that the person who served the food STUCK HIS FINGER ON THE INSIDE OF THE BOWL RIGHT INTO MY FOOD!!

I know the name is Roosters but all the roosters, pheasants whatever on the walls are creepy & I can only imagine how dusty they are.  I wouldn't want to sit under them.  That said, the food is standard grilled meat & fish & are tasty & presented well and everything is a la carte.  The meat portions were fair but I've noticed portions becoming smaller everywhere & here is no exception.  One vegetable side is b-a-r-e-l-y enough for two people, maybe three if you're sharing 3-4 sides.  I really liked the bacon grits even though I'm not usually a fan, but this is the only other starch if you don't care for potatoes.  Another lady I was with had never liked grits, but did enjoy a small portion.  The staff is excellent & I love how they bring the bottle of wine to the table to present to you and pour your glass even when you've only ordered the glass.  The after dinner drinks/coffees were intriguing and we tried several and they were mostly great - The Rusty Nail(?) was more like a weak tea.  The open kitchen adds to the extreme noisiness of this space, so be prepared for it to sound like bedlam in there.

Rooster was amazing from the time we walked in the door to the time we left. From the hostess, to the water server, to the bread server, to our waitress (ask for Elise, she was awesome!), to the manager, the service was outstanding. The food was even better - my husband got the pork chop which was phenomenal and I got the salami pizza which was also great. We split the Mac n cheese and fried corn which were both delicious and their Rosé and beer were fabulous as well. We will be coming back next time we are in Charlotte! Be sure to stop by.
Really well made upscale food with alot of comfort food mixed in.  Kinda small portions but thats the way I like it.  Cozy warm atmosphere where you can watch the cooks make your food.

This place is terrific. My mother-in-law insisted she take us here and we weren't disappointed. We got the fried chicken livers with what tasted like apple butter. They were cooked perfectly, not overdone at all. A lot of places struggle with that so we were very grateful. The burger was very good, cooked exactly how it was asked for. The fries were house made and very good. I had the mushroom pizza and it was amazing. The flavors were a perfect combination with the cheeses, mushrooms, and stone fired crust. It was just a real treat. We will be back!

I was very impressed with my meal at Roosters. The restaurant is spacious and is quite nice despite its somewhat kitschy looking exterior. The food is served a la carte and we were told by our server that everything from dressings to breadcrumbs is made from scratch in-house. They are a farm to fork concept, and look to support local whenever possible. The portions vary so if you're very hungry ask whether a side is necessary.  

I had the scallops (4 at $18) and added on the au gratin potatoes ($7). It was definitely enough food and everything tasted awesome. The potatoes were easily some of the best I've had, they had just a hint of gorgonzola cheese. 

We split two desserts , the lemon cheesecake with a blackberry topping and the coconut cake. The cheesecake was out of this world, more tart than sweet and just perfectly creamy. It was not a dessert I would normally order on my own but it will be an absolute must when I return! 

The only slight downside is you will end up smelling like a campfire, but it is well worth it!

Service was great. Good was tasty!  Had a mixed charcuterie and cheese plate. I left it to the waiter to select the meats and cheeses - he did well. Hangar steak, fries, pan-fried corn and green beans made for an excellent meal.
My first restaurant in Charlotte....meh.  While the servers were nice, service was pretty slow and the restaurant was empty.  The food was ok, but nothing to write home about.

Our experience wasn't very good. Our food had a nice presentation, appeared to be of good quality, but was surprisingly bland in all 3 cases. I had the Beef Short Ribs. It was nice that they were very tender, but were lacking flavor. Others at our table had the Duck and BBQ Chicken, and surprisingly, we all agreed that everything was bland.  Another disappointment was the over-priced average wine.
For our experience, and what we were expecting (from another recommendation) it was certainly way over-priced and not worth it.
The worst part was the waiter we had - he seemed to try to rush us through our decisions and seemed slightly irritated when we asked questions. The manager on duty was nice and stopped by to check on us. All in all, I'm guessing we had one of those "bad nights", and unfortunately, walked away without a reason to return.  For the dollar, there are many other restaurants we'd choose over this one.

i feel like i dont ever write bad reviews but i dont have anything bad to say about jim nobles roosters. you can get one of the best meals in charlotte along with one of the better wine list and not break the bank. sometimes i eat at places seasonally but this place has something for every taste and every time of year. lately i have been ordering their fish specials, a couple months ago it was flounder with fiddle head ferns and trumpet mushrooms, this past weekend it was carolina tilefish with fennel grapefruit and figs (mind you i dont like sweet anything) and a port reduction. the fish was absolutely flawless in every way and the accompaniments on the plate were mind blowing. we got a semi-traditional and perfect romaine and heirloom tomato (some of the best tomato's i have had this year and i consider myself a connoisseur) salad as a starter with a couple glasses of pinot gris and rose, split with my friend and left completely satisfied, full and bragging about our dinner later in the night. i love the atmosphere in the resty, the decor, and especially the bar area. we had originally sat @ a table, werent feeling the vibe and asked if we could cruise the bar, they were more than willing to oblige and then proceeded the exceed every expectation as usual. i say it all the time and i will say it again roosters in one of the finest meals in charlotte for the money

My wife and I have really grown to love Rooster's.  We met my brother and his wife there this past weekend and had several different menu items!  I had the BBQ chicken and my wife had the scallops.  Both dishes were wonderful!  Wine was flowing!  Can't wait to go back and try some new things!  We were there late so next time we plan to stick around a little longer!

This place was delish can't wait to try them again. Located in South Park but very easy to get to an we got lucky an parked right at the door :) The decor of course is roosters on the wall but not tacky lol dem lighting of course I was with my BFF lol We started with a cheese plate of course I luv cheese yum. We had a goat cheese that melted in your mouth an Brie plus another one I couldn't pronounce lol But all 3 were amazing in flavor .  I started with the Cesar salad the dressing was I could have used bread to wipe my dish to get it all lol It also had a few black olives that really made the salad. I ordered the salmon with asparagus an Mac n cheese. The salmon was perfectly cooked an seasoned flakey moist . Asparagus great flavor crispy not crunchy an the MAC n CHEESE made you wanna smack ya mama lol I'm a Mac n cheese girl n it was so creamy I couldn't figure out what kind of cheese they used I could have ate a huge pan of it lol and yes I had room for desert I ordered their coconut brownie.
