The coconut layer is on top than bottom layer is the brownie an it was warm . The only thing that could have kicked it up another notch would have been a glass of milk lol I am going back an I've heard the chicken is yum-o please go an try Roosters u won't be disappointed :)

One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte! I love all their food there. I like going for lunch because they have a wonderful Fried Oyster Salad. If I go for dinner, I usually get pasta or Fried Oysters with one of their sides (I really really REALLY like their Yukon Puree). For dessert, I love their Coconut Cake. Perfect place to eat after a day of shopping or to hang out with friends.

We went here on a Saturday night after seeing a show in Uptown.  We looked for places that were open since it was already 9pm when we decided to grab something to eat.  I'm so glad we did.  The meal was pricey, but the food was excellent.  We got the choose 3 cheese platter, my boyfriend got the pulled pork and roasted beets.  I got the braised beef rib and roasted turnips.  Everything was excellent.  I would definitely come here again.  The $75 bill was well worth it.    Due to the price, this isn't a place I can afford to go to every week, but we will definitely be back.  Side Note: As we were leaving, we noticed that the bar side of the restaurant has a bar small plates menu, so we probably will be back a little sooner to try.

Wow - such a special treat! We didn't have reservations so when we walked in (Friday night), the only seats they had available were at the Chef's table. We took them and to our surprise had an absolute blast! 

From the moment we sat down we were taken care of by the most professional and attentive group of people. Watching as your food is being made right in front of you is such a delight. Jake from the kitchen was awesome, he greeted as soon as we sat down and spent the next 2 hours checking in on us and giving us little facts about the place, the history and the foods they were preparing. Every plate leaving the kitchen was a beautiful and simple piece of art. You could tell that the team cared about the food they were serving, if something didn't look right, someone was always there to add the extra sauce or to sprinkle the plate with the missing garnishes. 

We had the mussels from the local menu - the sauce and ciabatta were crazy good. They make all of their bread in-house and you can taste the freshness. We moved on to the grilled salmon and the spit fire roasted chicken with pan fried corn and potato fingerlings and enjoyed every single bite. I have been craving a place like this - a place with fresh, local, organic foods (supporting our local farmers!) prepared with care and incredible attention to detail. The perfect portion sizes give you the opportunity to try a nice sampling of different options and even leave room dessert - try the coconut cake with an irish coffee. They have a nice wine list which included a few favorites of mine from back home (Duckhorn, Jordan and Pali). We won't be feeling guilty about eating here a few times a week, a great local spot!

Charlotte Yelpers most be a harsh bunch as this is a very high four at minimum so surprised by the 3.5 average.  I have been coming to Charlotte over the last four weekends and been staying and eating around Southpark and this is the best place.

The place is centered around the wood fire open kitchen and everything smells great.  The menu is a nice mix of meat, seafood and vegetables.  Some people might get annoyed at the a la carte nature of the sides but I liked that as I have been to many restaurants and really wanted some dish but did not get as did not like the sides that came with it.

The service has at minimum been good and if anything the servers can be a bit exuberant about all the food though I think for good reason as had the duck, salmon, and special seafood dish and loved them all.  The onion rings were perfectly as skinny and nicely breaded and not too fatty.  The only thing that disappointed a little was the salads which could have used some time in a crisper, a paper towel or a salad spinner as a bit soggy so the dressing did not stick.  They also did not have a true steakhouse style wedge salad.

Liked the beer selection also and the drinks in general were good though cocktails could have been a bit stronger.  In conclusion I have been here three times and likely to return a couple more times.

Good atmosphere; amazing bread, french onion soup, and BBQ chicken.  The whole place smells delicious - fresh baked bread and smokey wood.  Some of the dishes and sides are on both the expensive and small side.  They have a separate bar menu that is very good and more reasonably priced.  Always very busy, be sure to make a reservation.

I was visiting Charlotte and wanted to try something totally different, not the typical chain places like Applebee's. I was at the Southpark mall and wanted something relatively close which Roosters was. My first impression upon walking in was great. The hostess was friendly, loved the kitchen in the center and liked the different decor (stuffed roosters on one wall). My waiter was friendly and helpful, explaining the menu, how everything was local and giving me his advice on some menu items. I took his advice and got the duck confit, getting the asparagus as a side. When it came out, everything looked gorgeous. The asparagus was grilled, was a tad firm, but not at all chewy with a great taste. The duck was fantastic! I got full but hated to leave any of it left on my plate because it was so amazing. It had a great sauce, a nice crisp skin and was LITERALLY fall off the bone tender. Not kidding, I pulled on the bone when I cut into it, and the bone came out totally clean. I love duck, and that was one of the best duck meals I've ever had. Next time im in the area, I'll be back. I got those who meal items and a sweet tea and my total was just under 30 bucks, so not cheap, but I was full and pleased. I feel like for a once-in-a-while great meal, it was well worth it.

If the way to a man's heart is through his stomach, then I might get ditched for Jim Noble.  This man knows food!

I have eaten here on many occasions, and honestly, have never been disappointed. I find the portions to be sensible, and keep in mind that many of the items are a la carte.  If you order carefully, you will have plenty of food without breaking the bank.  This must be some sort of adaptive trait.

If you get nothing else, please take my advice and order the:

Pan fried corn.  Buttery and slightly browned.  It's to die for.

Duck confit: Phenomenal here.

Assorted Mushrooms: So good, that our dining neighbors *almost* took a bite before ordering their own!

Mac & Cheese: This is listed under pastas, not sides, or vegetables, duh.  It is OUT of this world.

The quarter or half natural chicken is also a great choice.  They also always have excellent specials. Last time it was the duck wing special that stole my heart.  I still catch myself thinking about those wings.... 

The servers I've had are always helpful. 

And for dessert? Get the coconut cake.

The atmosphere is country, cozy, and classy!

The staff alone at Rooster's make this 5 stars. The food would make it 6 stars if possible. Prices are very reasonable for the quality & perfection they present every time we eat there. The Duck Confit is superb. The Brisket Burger and Fries is my favorite burger in NC. PERIOD. You have to eat at this place! Good Drinks, Great Food. The Pork Shoulder Sandwich at 10 bucks is the best deal in Southpark. Very diverse menu.  I like some of the bread, but they need a nice butter to go with it, oil is ok but butter rules.
Yep! I'm a fan.  Got a cheese and cracker plate along with some mac and cheese, corn and wings - wow was it yummy.  The service was also very good.  Ill definitely be back!

Great place Great service and cool bar
Excellent food and menu offers a nice selection I had the coconut cake. One word --incredible 
The bread pudding was excellent 
Recommend to everyone
Will be back
Food was not too bad, I expected it to be better. I consider their food to be overpriced. Our waiter was very friendly and professional. Don't come here with high expectation on the foods.

Really great dining experience here! Great Waiter, Great Food. Had lunch here and had the fried oysters, peas, fried corn and dry rub smoked chicken.  food was fresh, hot and again the waiter was through and very consistent which for me is always appreciated! If you have never tried it, do yourself a favor and dine here!

Service is great! The waitress Leah was great at explaining the menu as it was our first time here. Food is fresh and is absolutely amazing. My husband had a burger and I had a turkey sandwich which was probably the best turkey sandwich I've ever had. We definitely recommend this place. Will be coming back here again.

We were in town for a concert, and chose this place for dinner based on the Yelp reviews and photos.  We were not disappointed!!! It is a little more "uppity" than I'd anticipated (the clientele are predominantly upper-middle-class), but I did not feel out-of-place in my jeans and Chuck Taylors.  Our server (I wish I had asked his name) was genuinely friendly, as were the other servers that would pass by - everyone greeted us with a smile.  We ordered rotisserie chicken, and it was the best I'd ever had.  I would recommend this place to anyone living in, or travelling through Charlotte.

Not bad. Good service, friendly staff, seated promptly!

I had the pork shoulder, and it was flavorful, juicy and tender. They served it with some slaw, and man this is the second time I've had slaw that tastes expensive. I also ate this arugula tomato salad.  It tasted fresh, the flavors went well together, and I liked the bits of cucumber with it.  It said the tomatos were sliced liek carpaccio which I thought my tomatos would be thinly sliced but they were about 1cm thick.  It's ok. I forgive them.  I had the dessert special after the waitress suggested it to me which was this apple bread pudding with vanilla bean ice cream... that... wasn't um great. I felt like I was scooping up butter.  It actually smelled like butter too.  I took like 5 bites and I just couldn't stomach it any longer.  Good news though, the waitress asked how it went and when I told her I wasn't a fan, she waived it!  I would have given this place 3 stars if the dessert wasn't waived but since it was, and since I know that the bread pudding isn't usually on the menu.. 4 stars!
Expensive, but perfectly sized portions and AMAZING dishes! The steak was phenomenal and the sides were great. Great staff, fun environment, will definitely go back.
Another great meal Saturday night at Roosters. The Duck Confit was amazing, also the Pâté and Fried Oysters. Grilled Corn and Sauté Mushrooms topped it off! Only draw back is the noise level.

I hopped up in this joint on a weekday afternoon. It was a bit chilly outside. You know, Uggs weather. It wasn't crowded at all. I sat at a table and pulled up "We Were 8 Years In Power" on my Kindle. 

I ordered a cup of tomato bisque, some calamari and mac n' cheese. My order came out in no time. All of it was delicious. The bisque was the perfect recipe for fighting off the chill of the fall breeze. The service was attentive and friendly and she was really helpful with guiding me to the good picks on the menu.

It wasn't too expensive and it was very filling. I'll definitely come back. It was a place with rich southern cuisine that I've come to love but without the confederate flag mystique of a cracker barrel or Kenny Rodgers place.

Well done!

You know... You come back to Charlotte, having been gone for ten years and, supposedly the food has gotten a lot better during that time, like it has around the country. So you look for some of the top new restaurants, and find Roosters, and Yelp gives it four stars with some glowing reviews and you're like... All right! It's 9:15, everything closes in 45 minutes, I'm in South Park, and wouldn't mind a nice sit down meal... LETS GO TO ROOSTERS!!

Siggggggghhhh. Ugh. Charlotte... So disappoint. 

I dunno. Maybe they were having an off night. I mean it IS Tuesday night. Perhaps expectations were wrong. The place itself, it's gorgeous. Really dug the look of it, the laid back, classy atmosphere, the wall of cock. But maaaaan. That food was OFF. 

We ordered the chicken liver mousse, which was covered with a rock hard layer of schmaltz that we had to drill through. I dunno what they put in there, but the seasoning was just off. Maybe sherry? 

Then the main dishes. The bbq pork shoulder. I don't understand. Why did you cube the pork like that? What was the point? And the slaw. It was warm. Warm slaw isn't a good thing. In fact it's a bad thing. A harbinger of pain to come, of frequent dates with the john and childhood summers filled with church bbqs, and Cole slaw left out too long in the sun. The fries were good though, a lot like the fries you get at Five Guys. 

We also ordered a couple of sides. The spinach was whatever. The Mac and Cheese? Have you all not had Mac and Cheese before?? The succotash was good, corn was sweet, well seasoned. Beans were a bit mushy, but maybe that's how they like it in Charlotte. And the fried chicken of the woods. I ate about five pieces before realizing that it wasn't actually chicken. Maybe cause I figured it was dry and tasteless and that's just how it was cause the rest of the meal didn't have much flavor either and that was probably the problem. 

THE SEASONING WAS ALL OFF. 

Like it wasn't consistent. 

Mac and cheese? BLAND
Wilted spinach? BLAND (did you all use unsalted butter to wilt the spinach??)
Fried chicken of the woods. Bland and blah. Even the ranch needed salt. 

The pork was actually well seasoned. And the succotash slightly over seasoned, little heavy on the salt. 

But seriously. Maybe the cooks were all in. Rush to get home and they forgot to salt everything. But you go to a nice restaurant, spend $90 for two people, you expect a little consistency between dishes. It shouldn't taste like we ordered from five different restaurants. 

But like I said, maybe an off night. If not, God bless em and God bless Charlotte because three stars is being generous. Seriously. Top 30 restaurants in Charlotte? Y'all out of your damn minds.

I was REALLY looking forward to going to Rooster's.  I had checked out the menu on the restaurant's webpage, and it looked great.  I read the reviews from other Yelpers, which made me hopeful.  Unfortunately, the dining experience I had with my girlfriend last week was simply dreadful.  

We ordered the fried green tomato appetizer, and it was truly ordinary.  The tomatoes were breaded too heavily, and there wasn't anything particularly flavorful on the plate.  For dinner, we ordered the flatiron steak, the half chicken, green beans, and cauliflower.  The meats were just dreadful.  The steak was undercooked, and it was served cold.  The chicken was warm when it was brought to the table, but it was so bland that it was not worth eating.  Candidly, a rotisserie chicken from the Fresh Market is much, much better than the chicken they served us here.  The vegetables weren't memorable in any way.  The beans were luke warm and a bit oily.  The cauliflower's sauce/flavoring was simply not enough to make it enjoyable.  We skipped dessert, for there seemed to be no point in prolonging the evening.  

While our waitress was quite good, the bartender we encountered inside the restaurant was clearly working in the wrong area of the restaurant.  When we asked him about some of the wines that they offer by the glass he told us "I don't drink wine".  Really?  Then why in the world are you working the bar?  I found that to be a total turn-off. 

I am really sad that Rooster's seems to have such terrible food.  The inside of the restaurant is really neat, and the staff (with the exception of our bartender) was friendly and competent.  We won't be returning.

This place is definitely not for people what want to stay away from oils I paid 23$ for 3 oz of cod and additional 11 for asparagus that I specifically asked to me cooked with no oil ! I don't know who these people are trying to lie to I can feel the oil on my lips and fingers I even  asked a friend to check and yet they insisted it wasn't oil !

Rooster's cares. They care about the food (exceptional) , the ingredients (local, farmed), the spices, people and patrons. They take care of you, as a guest you are family. The restaurahnt is truly a Southern jewel. The owner, kind hearted Christian, Jim Noble. The manager, tender, evasively strong Fernando Derado. You ruin your experience in Charloitte if you dont come here. 

~ex employee who knows the valyue of cuisine in Charlotte

I came here for lunch and ordered the scallops salad. It was a great combination of fresh and savory with the scallops, crunchy with the cornbread croutons and red peppers, creamy from the avocado and slightly sweet with the corn. It was a great portion for lunch - not too big but just enough to fill me up. The buttermilk lime dressing was really bright and a nice way to pull all the ingredients together. 

My mom ordered the very cake wrap and enjoyed that as well. However the beet cake wasn't so much a cake as it was puréed beets. 

Great service and delicious food - highly recommend!

We used to love this place but it has gone done hill in last few months. Not sure if there  is new management. Last two times in the place was  empty. We had lunch a few weeks ago and had the scallop salad.  Plate came with brown avocado and missing scallops. When we complained to manager he seemed pissed and argued with us on the scallop count and our issue with brown avocado.. We get this salad all of the time and know what to expect.. We were more put off by manager than food.. We went back today and had another mediocre meal. I got the arugula chicken salad. It looked like then took a plate threw a handful of arugula on it then dropped a solid chicken breast on top.. No blue cheese and salad dressing came in ramekin. Wife had veggie plate and some items seemed to be very over cooked. Bread which is usually very good was totally stale and cold the last two times.. 

Come on guys, plenty of places to have lunch in South Park. If I am going to pay $30 plus for lunch I shouldn't leaving wishing I went to Panera.

This place is amazing. Local food and everything taste so fresh. I had the duck wings and the pasta of the day and they both were amazing. The grits are out of this world. I would come just for the grits. The problem here is you don't know what to get bc it all looks great.

Delicious food!  The smoked wings are a must!  We also got the Mac & cheese as well as the butternut squash gratin for sides to share...both were amazing!  Everything is a la carte.  The drinks are a little pricey though. No think it's s good place to meet family or friends, and it's a cute date night spot.
Hanger Steak was cooked perfectly and tasted perfect with the wilted spinach and assorted mushrooms.

Food was outstanding...I tried two of the specials ---the potato soup and the mussels. Both were divine. The complimentary bread was a bit dry, but otherwise everything was delicious. We enjoyed Mac m cheese , zucchini and corn as our sides. They were l outstanding though the portions were small.
The server was cordial, but not super friendly and she just wasn't with it. I would have given five stars were the portions larger and the service outstanding.

This review is for the South Park location.  

I love this place.  Love the duck (breast and confit), bbq chicken, pan fried corn, scalloped potatoe side, etc., etc.

I've been here three times because I live so near and can walk to it, and while each time was not a horrible experience, it was not stellar either. 

The atmosphere and the bustle of the crowd lend more to the dining experience than the food itself. 

If you want a marginal experience, then this is it.

Watch what you order.  I had half an enemic chicken and peas and it was twice as expensive as my husbands MUCH more delicious turkey breast sandwich.  My arm got tired from flagging down the waiter and it took us an hour and a half to get in and out due to this.
We used a Groupon and Roosters added 20% to the bill in gratuity.  I get it that people tip based on the reduced price which is completely cheap and lame and you should be smacked in the head and publicly embarrassed for doing so.  But paying 20% for terrible service didn't add to the expereince.  At the Groupon price we paid $45 out the door for 2 entrees, 1 beer (great selection!!!!) and 2 desserts and that was fair.  It would have been $65 without the Groupon and that is WAY too much for lunch.
The french fries were the best thing we tried.  FANtastic.

Roosters is an upscale new American restaurant with a very chef-driven menu and a big wink (check out the wall of taxidermy roosters on the wall).
To start, I had the blood old fashioned with a bourbon-soaked cherry.  It was a bit sweet, but very delicious!  My boyfriend had the bourbon in the orchard cocktail, which was also very good! We also got the charcuterie board, with five choices that I've completely forgotten (duck liver mousse, an excellent aged gouda, a fennel salami, ???).  All of the charcuterie options were very thoughtful and we devoured the board in minutes (we're piranhas, basically).

For dinner, I had the hangar steak, my boyfriend had the duck breast.  Our other tablemates had the veal gnocci, scallops, salmon, and the smoked chicken wings.  Everyone cleaned their plates!  For sides, we had the Carolina gold rice (buttery in the best way), bacon-braised collard greens (I went back for thirds and fourths #nogreensleftbehind), potatoes au gratin (absolutely the best I've ever had), and asparagus (can't go wrong!).  We were pretty full, but we still peaked at the dessert menu (the snickerdoodle blondie sounded amazing).

Service was impeccable, our waitress was delightful and incredibly knowledgeable and helped steer us while reviewing the menu.  The owner (or manager?) stopped by our table several times to check on us.  All in all, we felt taken care of and we left with full tummies and a great experience.

Excellent Sunday brunch ! Great service ! Arrived 12:45 for 1 o'clock reservation and was seated immediately!
Smells great inside with the wide open kitchen! 
Coconut cake dessert was outstanding!

They have excellent food. It's quite the culinary experience. The reason only four stars is because if it's your first time there he menu can be confusing. And the waiter/bartender who helped us just confused us more and we ended up getting waaaaay more food than we could eat, you live and you learn. 
Not only that but you need to make a reservation for dinner no matter what time day or time you go. We didn't make a reservation on a Tuesday night and we were seriously frowned upon. Felt all judged for having the gall to enter with no ressies.

The restaurant has a nice and relaxing ambiance . My husband and I started with the iceberg , blue cheese salad . For dinner , I had the salmon and he had the seared sea scallops .  We ordered the pan fried corn and the haricot vert as sides . For desert , we had the pumpkin cheese cake .
Starting  with the salad , the lettuce was not very crisp . My salmon was excellent so were the sides . However  , we thought paying 20 dollars for four pieces of scallops which was my husbands dinner entree was too much and wasn't worth it . The cheese cake was also good .

I would give two stars for the food and pricing, but the manager of Rooster's bumped it to three stars. 

Though it was not my favorite dining experience, the manager came by personally several times during the meal to check on the taste and experience, as well as delivered part of our order to the table himself. Kudos to this gentleman for caring about his customers, that did not go unnoticed. 

The waitress noticed us taking time to look at the menu and when we presented questions to her she states "this must be your first time". Well, yes, but that should have probably been asked upon our seating and her introduction. We gave her the benefit of the doubt but she performed her job in a flustered manner on the evening that we dined. 

For taste, I must say the meal was only mediocre. I had the quarter chicken with a side of green beans (most items are a la carte), my boyfriend had the steak burger. The waitress did not understand our original order and never brought our second side, which was going to be the pan fried corn. Flavor lacked and I found myself wishing there was a sauce to dip the chicken in. Green beans had a watery sauce on them that in the end just watered down the spices that they tried to flavor with. Pricing is higher than what the quality of the meal deserves. But to each their own, you should always try a place at least once. 

To leave you with a positive, the summer drink menu has a pineapple cocktail on it, this you should try, it was delicious.

Hubby and I went here for our anniversary. Fantastic. Is it overpriced? Totally. But is it delicious? Oh heck yeah. Don't come here if you're on a low-fat diet. Had the short ribs--- best short ribs I've ever had. Their Mac n cheese is also to die for.

First let me start off by saying we went to have a date night and preferred a booth but as we waited at the bar we sat up by the kitchen and decided to eat front row. Not only were we served with grade A hospitality by the hostess the appetizer and entree both came out with  10 minutes of ordering . Quick service and quality food no doubt we will be back to try the roasted duck!

Great food, great atmosphere.

The farm to table, family style dining makes for a great night with friends and family.

The sides are always fresh, and the meats are cooked to perfection. My personal favorite is the short rib, but it's all good.

Highly recommend to anyone looking for that fresh home cooked meal.

We can agree or disagree on the food, it a matter of taste. They have a solid diverse menu with variety of options that almost fit everyone. By far the hanger steak and the duck are my to-go on the menu. Also, the cocktails and wine menu is good. Nothing too special, but good. 

That being said, what makes Rooster's special is their top-notch service. PERFECT service. Fast enough, everyone is so friendly, and better, they truly care to give you a good experience.

This place is tip top!
Food was amazing I asked for the best thing on the menu and after choosing 3 of the 10 recommendations, I can't wait to go back. A comfort modern style restaurant with open kitchen concept.  Cocktails are delightful and made w/ custom craftsmanship.

Ok, when we pulled up in the park lot I was thinking "I sure hope this place is decent" and I tell you what, the food here is really good. We has pate', duck breast and the short rib with asparagus and grits. We will definitely be back.

This update is long overdue! Since my last review I have been to Rooster's several times, for a drink and appetizer at the bar and for dinner. And, I have to say the service has improved.

The food continues to not disappoint. I have always been a huge fan of the pizzas, but have recently branched out and tried a few new items. The chicken, of course, is always great, but I have enjoyed the duck, shrimp and flounder specials and most recently the beef carpaccio. Don't forget to ask for bread upon arrival, so fresh and served with an olive oil and balsamic blend, love!

When the weather is nice try to grab a table outside, if not, enjoy the wall of Roosters.

Always consistently awesome! I've worked at nobles a long long time ago and the perfection and passion in their food is still reflected at roosters as well. Some people say it's pricey but you get what you pay for and they use the best of the best ingredients as well as seasonal produce that is amazing. I've never had anything here that wasn't delightful!

I took my parents here last night for father's day. We stopped in at around 5:30, after I baked in the sun staying in line for Summer Pops at Symphony Park so that I could put our blanket down. It worked out perfectly (in my opinion), so for those who are planning to go to Summer Pops this month, consider putting down blanket and head to dinner. It's inhumane to make any one person to sit out there in the sun for 3 hours. I cannot imagine it to be any fun or at all enjoyable even with bottles of wine. 

Back to Rooster's... it was quite empty when we arrived. I opted to sit at the bar area (because they have bar bites after 4pm daily). The only disadvantage is that bar area seatings are all backless high stools, not the most comfortable but it's not bad. The bartender was also our server, which they may need to reconsider that. The bar is long, and the opening is toward the back away from all the tables. That means the poor lady has to walk AROUND the bar every time she's trying to reach any of her tables. Needless to say, the service eventually got to be a little slow, with other people stepping in to help out. I didn't mind, we weren't in a hurry, but I could see it being a problem for others.

Food was solid. I have always enjoyed the food at Rooster's. We ended up ordering an array of dishes to share. We had 2 things off the bar bites chalkboard: chicken pot pie ($8) & the pork rillettes served on toasts ($6). The pot pie which was super cute in presentation and tasted great. It looked like a treasure box which was made of a nice flaky crust. The pork rillettes was ok... the apple butter was a little overpowering. From the dinner menu I ordered sea scallops ($18), gnocchi ($12) and mussels ($9). 4 sea scallops came in an order, and while it was seared cripsy on top, it was a little over seasoned. I enjoyed it still, especially the pea puree they were served on. Gnocchi was light and fluffy, and cooked in a duck sugo sauce. So if you are not into liver, you probably need to skip this. Mussels were good, about 18 in an order, and came with a big piece of toast to soak up the sauce. We ended the meal with the bourbon cream pudding ($8). We were a little disappointed they're out of the coconut cake... but the pudding was a good alternative. 

Overall it was a great meal. My parents enjoyed it, the open kitchen kept them entertained. It's a nice quiant setting, which I prefer over all the crazy large restaurants in the area. Now if management can figure out the bar area service assignment, I can then relax for the bartender.

All around amazing! Impeccable service, simple menu all done very well. I had the hangar steak seasoned well and cooked perfectly. My family had the half bbq chicken and the duck breast and thoroughly enjoyed. We split the buttered spinach, pan fried corn, and Mac n cheese. YUM! Highly recommend for a special occasion. Extensive wine list as well!

Date night was a success because I chose Rooster's.

Great attentive service, though the waiter was a little touchy feely. I guess that's how he likes to interact with his customers, touching shoulders and such. Odd, but not odd enough to say anything.

We opted to skip appetizers and went right to the mains. My wife chose the roasted duck breast which she said was excellent. Very moist, very tasty, truly delicious. I chose the half barbecue chicken and it was awesome. Super moist, very tangy, really easy to eat with knife and fork. Yum and a bunch of it went home.

For sides, we chose three veggies to share - roasted beets, Yukon puree (really, mashed potatoes) and steamed spinach. All were great.

No dessert today. I should have saved room for that coconut cake.
I have been here twice- the first time it was great, the second, yeah not so much.

****/** 4.75 stars. Back again with a couple of individuals that had not dined here before. The service was great as usual. Out of the popular pork shoulder again!!  The pork shoulder rocks and they cannot make enough to go around.

Both individuals were very impressed with the food. It is really amazing, just a great dining experience. I have never been here for lunch but the dinners are impressive.

This is a tasting/sampling type menu. If you want big portions you will not like this restaurant. Of course you can always have big portions by ordering lots of little portions. 

The data speaks for the rating. Everyone I have brought here is impressed. We always get treated like royalty.

Roosters is an excellent price/value in the upscale gourmet cusine category. You get what you paid for.
The dressing in the salad was delicious!!! Seriously want to get some to take home to Raleigh. Waiter recommends the chicken wrap. So good!!!

Food: this place expresses themselves well. Roasted chicken, pulled pork and seafood are on the menu. You can smell the food as soon as you walk in. I started with the onion soup and had a grilled chicken sandwich with caramelized onions. Everything tasted good, but the chicken sandwich was smaller than I would have liked.  While nicely prepared, I'm not sure I'd get the sandwich again. However, the soup was one of the best I've had.

Service: no problems here. Attentive. Polite. 

Atmosphere: open, you can smell the kitchen which is in the middle of the restaurant, busy, maybe a little noisy for a business lunch, but not so loud where it got in the way

$100 after tip for 4 people for lunch

While the name smacks of some sort of TGI McApplegarden, Rooster's Wood-Fired Kitchen is pleasant oasis in the middle of strip mall hell. This casual, nay, "relaxed" restaurant pays attention to detail, both in service and food preparation. Plates are served in tasting portions so this is the perfect place to go alone or with a big group. Definitely recommended.

This was a great dinner. The decor of the restaurant is really nice-open but with dark wood and cool design. Ordered the BBQ chicken, which was delicious. It was a decent portion with a delectable sauce. Delicious beets and corn as well. Steak is a small cut but very tasty. Go for the poultry, they are kind of known for it. Reminded me a bit of Tom Colicchio's Craft in NYC with the ala carte sharing menu and market menu. Not as pricey, but equal quality. A great place for a date or a group.

Very solid restaurant with a horrible location. Nothing is more uninspiring than a corporate office building, but despite the locale, the food shined. Charcuterie and smoked wings were spot on and the pork shank with bean cassoulet and bacon lardon was great.

Had a friend's birthday dinner here over the weekend.  We had 16 people (so some of the issues could be due to the size...but I doubt that - see below).

We arrived slightly after our reservation time.  We alerted the hostess that we were here for a birthday party - I guess they had three.  We saw the rest of the group in "the cellar" which is through the restaurant and through a shopping mall hallway. There's a large bar that runs the length of the room.  We were sat into two - eight person tables.  No major issues. 

We ordered a bottle of wine to share - the waiter opened the bottle (with a little too much force) and some wine went shooting out.  Luckily, it didn't get onto anyone's clothes (it was a Rioja - tempranillo (red)).  However, there was some (not a lot) on the table/plates/etc.  The wine wasn't expensive - or else I would have been a little more upset.

We had snacked earlier at Corkbuzz (see other review) so I got the mussels, and my friends go the spaghetti, the shrimp, and the duck.  When I ordered the spaghetti for my friend, the waiter responded, "Really?!  um, ok." - with an eye roll.  

After a question about how the shrimp was prepared, my other friend ordered the shrimp.  We all received our orders.  $18 for seven shrimp.  No sides...just seven grilled shrimp.  "Maybe the shrimp were huge shrimp"....nope, just normal grilled shrimp.

My mussels were good - one unopened, but they were better when I had them at the uptown location a couple weeks prior.  Spagetti was good!  The duck was amazing.

So, meh service, some things of horrible value.

Rooster's SouthPark is easily one of chef Noble's best restaurants. The atmosphere is date night/special night level nice, but at the same time it's not too serious inside. The decor is a bit whimsical if a little lodge-y. The front of house and waitresses/waiters offer some of the best service in the city. There is a variety of seating options. 

To the food: the food here is consistently outstanding. I feel like the kitchen has figured out some secret to offering great service and great food. I highly recommend their sides! Any protein, their pastas, or their pizzas (which are under appreciated I think).

Took my wife, her sister and our neighbor for Mothers Day. Once again we were met with great food and great service  The fried oyster appetizer came out hot and crispy and succulent. Caesar salad was wonderfulness as always. Just the right size vs a darn entree sized salad when all you want is a side. Pasta of the day with duck confit = yum and same thing for the cauliflower and onion rings. Dessert?  No brainer. Coconut cake or bust. I even got a bite of honey's without suffering any bodily harm. A good night as always.
